destinations.description: Himachal Pradesh, nestled in the western Himalayas, is a picturesque northern Indian state known for its breathtaking landscapes, snow-clad peaks, and serene valleys. Often referred to as the 'Land of Gods' (Dev Bhoomi), it is dotted with ancient temples, peaceful monasteries, and charming hill towns.

price.per: Per Person

highlights: 12 km scenic Kheerganga trek through dense forests
Natural hot water springs with healing properties
Overnight camping under starry Himalayan skies
Famous Israeli cafes in Kasol – Jim Morrison, Moon Dance
Visit Manikaran Sahib Gurudwara & hot springs
Bonfire and music session at campsite
Sunrise & sunset views from 3,050 meters altitude
inclusions: Accommodation: 1 night in Kasol + 1 night in Kheerganga campsite
3 Breakfasts & 2 Dinners
Transportation from Delhi (AC Volvo bus)
All toll taxes and parking
All sightseeing as per itinerary

itinerary.title: Departure from Delhi – Overnight Journey
highlights: Board AC Volvo bus from Delhi
itinerary.description: Your amazing Himachal trip begins in the evening as you board the AC Volvo bus from Delhi to Kasol. Settle into your comfortable seat and enjoy the 9-10 hour journey through the night. Watch the stars, feel the chill breeze, listen to music, or simply relax as you head towards the mountains.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Kasol – Cafes & Local Exploration
highlights: Jim Morrison Café & Moon Dance Café
itinerary.description: Early morning arrival in the beautiful town of Kasol, located in the Parvati Valley. Our driver will take you to your accommodation. Relax for a while, then begin your exploration of this charming hill town. Visit iconic cafes like Jim Morrison Café or Moon Dance Café. Don't miss trying authentic Israeli food, for which Kasol is famous. You can also shop for interesting Pahadi items, woolens, and handicrafts. In the evening, enjoy the chill vibes with soft music. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kheerganga Trek – Waterfalls & Hot Springs
highlights: Wake up early for trek preparation
itinerary.description: Wake up early and enjoy a healthy breakfast to fuel up for the adventurous Kheerganga trek. Board a local taxi to reach Barshaini, the starting point of the trek. Begin your 12 km trek which takes approximately 4-5 hours. Along the way, enjoy stunning waterfalls, natural hot springs, breathtaking mountain views, and dense pine and oak forest paths. Upon reaching Kheerganga at 3,050 meters altitude, reward yourself with stunning photographs. Sit quietly, witness the mesmerizing sunset, and later gather around the bonfire. A delicious hot dinner will be served. Sleep peacefully in your campsite under the starry Himalayan sky.

itinerary.title: Trek Down – Manikaran Sahib & Departure
highlights: Holy hot springs with healing properties
itinerary.description: Wake up early to witness the spectacular sunrise over the Himalayas at Kheerganga. Enjoy a delicious breakfast, then begin your trek down to Barshaini (another 4-5 hours). Upon reaching, visit the sacred Manikaran Sahib Gurudwara, a revered religious site for both Hindus and Sikhs. Don't miss the holy hot springs, believed to have healing and medicinal properties. Continue your journey back to Kasol, where you can do some last-minute shopping for souvenirs and local handicrafts. In the evening, board your Volvo bus to Delhi, carrying wonderful memories of your Himachal adventure.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Expect chilly mornings and cool evenings even in summer.
Pack warm layers and woolens for high-altitude regions.
Sturdy trekking/hiking shoes are essential.
Sunscreen and sunglasses are musts due to higher UV at elevation.
Carry a waterproof jacket (rain protection).

keyInfo.title: Trek Difficulty
points: Kheerganga trek is moderate in difficulty.
Total distance: 12 km one way (24 km round trip).
Trek duration: 4-5 hours uphill, 3-4 hours downhill.
Suitable for beginners with basic fitness level.
Altitude gain: From 1,900m to 3,050m.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Kasol has decent mobile and Wi-Fi coverage.
Jio and Airtel work reasonably well.
Kheerganga has very limited/no network - embrace digital detox.
Carry cash as ATMs are only in Kasol and Bhuntar.

keyInfo.title: Food and Water
points: Enjoy simple mountain fare - momos, maggi, rajma-chawal, thukpa.
Kasol is famous for Israeli cuisine and bakeries.
Drink only bottled or filtered water.
Eat at trusted cafes and pre-recommended places.
Carry energy bars, nuts, and chocolates for the trek.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Himachalis are warm and respectful - greet with 'Namaste'.
Dress modestly in villages and religious sites.
Always ask before photographing locals.
Remove shoes before entering Gurudwara and temples.
Respect local customs and traditions.

keyInfo.title: Health Precautions
points: Carry basic medicines - pain relievers, antiseptic, bandages.
Motion sickness pills for winding mountain roads.
Avoid overexertion on the first day.
Stay hydrated during the trek.
Carry ORS packets and quick energy supplements.

keyInfo.title: Local Laws
points: Alcohol is available in licensed shops, avoid drinking in public.
Cannabis grows wild here but its use is strictly illegal.
Respect forest boundaries and local customs.
Follow trekking guidelines and stay on marked trails.

keyInfo.title: Eco-Responsibility
points: Protect Himachal's fragile ecosystems.
Carry your trash back - leave no trace.
Avoid plastic - carry a reusable water bottle.
Stick to marked trekking trails.
Say no to bonfires in forest areas.
Respect wildlife and natural habitats.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: May to June: Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking.
September to October: Post-monsoon, clear skies.
December to February: Snow trek (requires experience/gear).
Avoid July-August: Heavy rainfall, landslide risk.

keyInfo.title: Emergency Contacts

destinations.description: Discover the pristine beauty of the Andaman Islands with turquoise waters, sun-kissed beaches, vibrant coral reefs, and lush tropical landscapes. This island paradise offers the perfect blend of adventure, relaxation, and history in the Bay of Bengal.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Port Blair – Cellular Jail & Light Show
itinerary.description: Your Andaman tour begins as you fly to Port Blair Airport. Our representative will meet and assist you at the airport, then drive you to your hotel. Check-in and relax for a while. In the afternoon, visit the historic Cellular Jail, a three-storey prison built by the Britishers in 1906, where our freedom fighters spent gruesome years. In the evening, witness the enchanting light and sound show at Cellular Jail, which vividly portrays the struggle for independence. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Port Blair.

itinerary.title: North Bay Island (Coral Island) & Ross Island
itinerary.description: After breakfast, get ready to visit North Bay Island, also known as Coral Island, famous for its vibrant coral reefs and water sports. Enjoy a boat ride to the island where you can indulge in thrilling activities like Scuba Diving, Sea Walking, Snorkeling, and glass-bottom boat rides at additional costs. Next, proceed to Ross Island (Subash Chandra Bose Island), where you'll explore historical ruins including the Chief Commissioner's House, Government House, Church, Bakery, Swimming Pool, and Cemetery. Finally, visit Corbyn's Cove Beach, located 7km from Port Blair town. Relax on the shores, click pictures, and enjoy the coastal vibes. Return to your hotel for overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Neil Island – Bharatpur Beach & Natural Coral Bridge
itinerary.description: Wake up and enjoy your breakfast. Get ready to visit Bharatpur Beach, famous for its water activities. Take a glass bottom boat ride to see beautiful marine life through the transparent floor. Later, visit the Natural Coral Bridge, also known as Howrah Bridge, a unique natural formation created by dead corals over centuries. Conclude your exploration at Neil Island, then catch a ferry back to Port Blair. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Havelock Island – Radhanagar Beach
itinerary.description: After breakfast, you'll be transferred to Phoenix Bay Harbour to board the ferry to Havelock Island, also known as Swaraj Deep. This beautiful island is part of Ritchie's Archipelago and has been voted as the Best Beach in Asia by Time Magazine. Upon arrival, check into your beachside resort. Later, head to Radhanagar Beach, recognized as one of the best beaches in Asia. Spend quality time walking on the pristine white sands, swimming in crystal clear waters, or simply relaxing as the sun sets. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Havelock.

itinerary.title: Elephant Beach – Snorkeling & Coral Paradise
highlights: 40-45 min boat ride to Elephant Beach
itinerary.description: Wake up early and enjoy your breakfast. Set out for Elephant Beach via a 40-45 minute scenic boat ride. Upon arrival, relax for a while, then explore the stunning Elephant Beach. Complimentary snorkeling is included, allowing you to experience vibrant coral reefs and colorful marine life up close. Elephant Beach is famous for its excellent snorkeling conditions and underwater biodiversity. After enjoying your time at the beach, return to your resort in Havelock for a peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kalapathar Beach & Transfer to Neil Island
itinerary.description: After breakfast, check out from your hotel in Havelock. Visit Kalapathar Beach, known for its black rocks and serene atmosphere. Admire the beauty, relax on the shore, and enjoy scenic coastal views. Later, board the ferry to Neil Island. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and relax for a while. Overnight stay at Neil Island.

itinerary.title: Departure from Port Blair
itinerary.description: On the final day, wake up to the beautiful ambiance of Port Blair. Enjoy your hearty breakfast, then pack your bags as your 6-night 7-day Andaman package comes to an end. Check out from your hotel, and our representative will take you to the airport. Board your flight back home, carrying unforgettable memories of turquoise waters, white sands, and island adventures with Travel Junky.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Tropical and humid climate throughout the year.
Light cottons, breathable clothing, swimsuits, and flip-flops are recommended.
Carry a sunhat, sunscreen (SPF 50+), and sunglasses.
Light jacket or shawl for boat rides and windy evenings.
Waterproof bag for ferry journeys and beach visits.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: October to May – Ideal weather, calm seas, perfect for water activities.
November to February – Pleasant temperatures, best for sightseeing.
March to May – Hot and humid, but great for snorkeling and diving.
June to September – Monsoon season, ferry disruptions possible.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Port Blair has decent mobile (4G) and Wi-Fi coverage.
Havelock and Neil Island have limited BSNL/Airtel network.
Jio works selectively in some areas.
Consider it the perfect excuse for a digital detox.
Carry sufficient cash – ATMs are limited outside Port Blair.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water
points: Fresh seafood is a highlight – lobster, crab, tuna, red snapper.
South Indian, Bengali, and North Indian cuisine widely available.
Stick to bottled water for drinking.
Eat at popular cafes and hotel restaurants to avoid food issues.
Try local coconut water and fresh lime soda.

keyInfo.title: Ferry Information
points: Government ferries: Cheaper but slower, book in advance.
Private ferries: Makruzz, Green Ocean, Coastal Cruise – faster and more comfortable.
Journey time: Port Blair → Havelock (1.5-2 hrs), Havelock → Neil (30-45 min).
Carry motion sickness pills if prone to seasickness.
Reach ferry terminal 45 mins before departure.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Andaman is peaceful and culturally diverse.
Dress modestly when not on the beach.
Avoid public intoxication.
Respect local tribal communities – do not try to interact with or photograph them.
Photography prohibited near defense installations.

keyInfo.title: Health Precautions
points: Carry motion sickness pills for ferry rides.
Sunscreen, mosquito repellent, and basic first aid kit essential.
Basic medical facilities available in Port Blair.
Remote islands may not have immediate medical care.
Travel insurance strongly recommended.

keyInfo.title: Local Laws
points: Photography prohibited near defense installations and tribal reserves.
Alcohol available in Port Blair and Havelock (permit required for some areas).
Public drinking not allowed.
Avoid littering beaches and marine areas.
Do not touch or step on corals – strictly prohibited.

keyInfo.title: Eco-Responsibility
points: These islands are ecologically sensitive.
Avoid single-use plastics – carry reusable water bottle.
Don't touch coral or marine life while snorkeling.
Carry back your waste – take only memories, leave only footprints.
Use reef-safe sunscreen to protect marine ecosystems.
Respect marine life – do not feed fish.

points: Swimwear and beach essentials
Light cotton clothes and evening jacket
Sturdy flip-flops and water shoes
Sunscreen, sunglasses, sunhat
Mosquito repellent
Power bank (limited charging points on ferries)
Waterproof phone pouch
Basic medications

itinerary.title: Arrival in Port Blair – Corbyn's Cove Beach & Cellular Jail
itinerary.description: The Andaman Islands tour package will kickstart as you fly to Port Blair Airport. From there, our representative will meet and assist you at the Airport, then you will drive to your amazing stay location at Andaman. As you arrive, check into your hotel and relax for a while. Then start your excursion of the Andaman by visiting Corbyn's Cove Beach, which is over 7km from Port Blair town. Click some pictures, or simply sit on the shores of the beach. Later, be excited as you will visit the place where our Freedom fighters had spent some of the gruesome years of their life, Cellular Jail. A three-storey prison was built by the British in 1906. After exploring Cellular Jail, our representative will take you back to the hotel. Enjoy your overnight sleep at Port Blair.

itinerary.title: Havelock Island – Radhanagar Beach
itinerary.description: On the second day of your Andaman Islands itinerary, you will uncover the new island that is Havelock Island. Thus, rise and shine, have your mouthwatering breakfast, and then you will be transferred to the Phoenix Bay Harbour to board the ferry taking you to Havelock Island, also known as the Swaraj Deep. This beautiful island is part of the Ritchie's Archipelago and has been voted as the Best Beach in Asia by Time Magazine. Once you arrive, check into your beachside resort, and later you will head to the Radhanagar Beach, recognised as one of the best beaches of Asia. Here, spend some quality time at the beach by walking or relaxing. After exploring Radhanagar beach, you will come back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Elephant Beach – Snorkeling & Coral Paradise
highlights: 40-45 min boat ride to Elephant Beach
itinerary.description: On the third day, you will discover the elephant beach. Wake up early, have your mouthwatering breakfast, and then set out to Elephant Beach. You will enjoy a 40-45 minute boat ride to reach Elephant Beach. Upon arrival, our representative will drop you at your stay location, relax here for a while. Then set out to explore Elephant Beach. Snorkelling will be complimentary so that you can enjoy the marine life for free. You will get the best experience of Snorkeling here, as the Elephant Beach is famous for its vibrant coral life and colorful marine life. After enjoying your time at Elephant beach, you will head back to your resort for a peaceful sleep.

itinerary.title: Kalapathar Beach & Transfer to Neil Island
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, you will uncover the new stunning island that is Neil Island. Rise and shine, have your hearty breakfast, and then check out of your hotel. You will head to Neil Island by visiting Kalapathar Beach. On your route, enjoy the scenic resorts and the diving centre. At the Kalapathar beach, you can also admire the beauty or relax on the shore. Later, you will board the ferry that will take you to Neil Island. As you arrive, check into your hotel and relax for a while.

itinerary.title: Neil Island – Bharatpur Beach & Natural Coral Bridge
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, wake up and have your satisfying breakfast. Then get ready to visit the Bharatpur Beach, which is famous for its water activities. You can do the glass bottom ride to see the beautiful marine life through the glass bottom boat. Later, you will visit the Natural Coral Bridge, also known as Hawrah Bridge, a natural bridge formed by dead corals. Conclude your exploration at Neil Island, and then you will catch a ferry to Port Blair. Once you arrive, check into your hotel and enjoy an overnight stay here.

itinerary.title: Departure from Port Blair
itinerary.description: On the sixth day, rise early to this beautiful ambience that Port Blair creates. Your hearty breakfast will be served. After enjoying your meal, pack your bags as today is the end of the Andaman 5 nights 6 days package. After packing, check out of your hotel. Our representative will take you to the airport. Board your flight, carrying all the unforgettable memories that you have created in Andaman with Travel Junky's service. To enjoy more such trips, we have also specially designed itineraries like Andaman Islands Itinerary: A Perfect 6-Day Escape.

This beautiful island is part of the Ritchie's Archipelago and has been voted as the Best Beach in Asia by Time Magazine. Once you arrive, check into your beachside resort, and later you will head to the Radhanagar Beach, recognised as one of the best beaches of Asia. Here, spend some quality time at the beach by walking or relaxing. After exploring Radhanagar beach, you will come back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kalapathar Beach & Return to Port Blair
itinerary.description: On the third day, you will uncover the new stunning island that is Neil Island. Rise and shine, have your hearty breakfast, and then check out of your hotel. You will head to Neil Island by visiting Kalapathar Beach. On your route, enjoy the scenic resorts and the diving centre. At the Kalapathar beach, you can also admire the beauty or relax on the shore. Later, you will board the ferry that will take you to Port Blair. As you arrive, check into your hotel and relax for a while.

itinerary.title: Departure from Port Blair
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, rise early to this beautiful ambience that Port Blair creates. Your hearty breakfast will be served. After enjoying your meal, pack your bags as today is the end of the 3-night 4-day Andaman itinerary. After packing, check out of your hotel, our representative will take you to the airport. Board your flight, carrying all the unforgettable memories that you have created in Andaman with Travel Junky's service.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Tropical and humid climate throughout the year.
Light cottons, breathable clothing, swimsuits, and flip-flops are your best friends.
Carry a sunhat, sunscreen (SPF 50+), and sunglasses.
Light jacket for boat rides and windy evenings.
Waterproof bag for ferry journeys and beach visits.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: October to May – Ideal weather, calm seas, perfect for water activities.
November to February – Pleasant temperatures, best for sightseeing.
March to May – Hot and humid, but great for beach visits.
June to September – Monsoon season, ferry disruptions possible.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity

Consider it the perfect excuse for a digital detox.
Carry sufficient cash – ATMs are limited outside Port Blair.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water

South Indian, Bengali, and North Indian cuisine widely available.
Stick to bottled water for drinking.
Eat at popular cafes and hotel restaurants to avoid food-related issues.

destinations.description: Nestled on the southwestern coast of India, Kerala is a land of stunning contrasts, where serene backwaters meet rolling hills, and golden beaches stretch beneath swaying palm trees. Known as 'God's Own Country,' Kerala enchants travelers with its rich cultural heritage, lush landscapes, and warm hospitality.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Cochin – Drive to Munnar via Waterfalls
itinerary.description: Your journey to serene Kerala begins as you arrive at Cochin Airport or Railway Station. Our driver will welcome you and take you to the 'Kashmir of the South' – Munnar. During this 3-4 hour journey, enjoy the incredible Cheeyappara and Valara Waterfalls along the route. Click soothing photos or take a quick dip in the fresh, chilly water. You'll also visit a beautiful spice garden to experience Kerala's aromatic treasures. In the evening, reach your accommodation in Munnar. Rest well to prepare for the next day's exploration.

itinerary.title: Munnar Sightseeing – Dams, Lakes & Tea Gardens
itinerary.description: After breakfast, head to explore Munnar's main attractions. Visit Mattupetty Dam and its perennial lake, surrounded by pretty natural landscapes. Proceed to the gorgeous Kundala Lake, enveloped in greenery and beautiful vegetation. Next, experience Echo Point, located 25 km from Munnar at over 600 feet above sea level – say something and hear it echo back. Enjoy the scenic tea gardens nearby. Discover the history and evolution of tea cultivation at the Tata Tea Museum. Continue to Eravikulam National Park, a 25-minute drive from Munnar. This UNESCO World Heritage site is home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr, elusive lion-tailed macaque, and the world's largest moth – the Atlas moth. Return to your accommodation for a peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Munnar to Thekkady – Wildlife & Cultural Evening
itinerary.description: After breakfast, bid farewell to Munnar and head to the 'Spice Bag of Kerala' – Thekkady. Enjoy a beautiful 4-hour drive through the hills and valleys of the Western Ghats. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and rest. Begin your exploration at Periyar National Park and Lake – a tiger reserve perfect for animal lovers. Spot unique species or simply sit by the serene Periyar Lake. Later, visit the elephant camp where you can interact directly with elephants – feed them or enjoy a ride. In the evening, entertain yourself with a mesmerizing Kathakali dance show and a thrilling martial arts performance. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Thekkady to Alleppey – Venice of the South
itinerary.description: Wake up early, enjoy breakfast, and head to Alleppey – the 'Venice of the South' – approximately 5 hours away. Upon arrival, check into your hotel. Visit the Shri Krishna Temple, a beautiful traditional Kerala-style temple. Don't miss the temple's famous rice pudding, 'Palpayasam'. Enjoy leisure time at Alleppey Beach, stroll along the coastline, or try the famous Shikara ride through narrow canals and serene backwaters. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Alleppey to Varkala – Cliffs & Arabian Sea
itinerary.description: After breakfast, bid farewell to Alleppey and set off to Varkala, an amazing beach town in Kerala. En route, visit the Jatayu Earth Centre, home to the world's largest bird sculpture. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and rejuvenate. Varkala is unique – the only town in Kerala with 15-meter high cliffs overlooking the Arabian Sea. Explore Varkala Beach, known for its beautiful cliffs and quiet atmosphere. Take your time discovering nearby places at your own pace. Return to your hotel for a peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Varkala to Kovalam – Samudra & Lighthouse Beaches
highlights: Bird's eye view of Arabian Sea
itinerary.description: After a hearty breakfast, set out for Kovalam – a 4-hour scenic journey. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and begin exploring Samudra Beach, for which Kovalam is famous. Swim in the blue waters or simply relax on the coastline. Later, visit the iconic Lighthouse Beach with its 36-meter tall lighthouse, offering the best bird's eye view of the Arabian Sea and backwaters. Wrap up your day and return to your accommodation for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kovalam to Trivandrum – Temples & Museums
itinerary.description: After breakfast, head to Trivandrum, Kerala's capital city surrounded by seven hills. Begin your exploration at the magnificent Padmanabhaswamy Temple, a Vishnu temple with a massive fort gateway built in Dravidian style. Visit the Sri Chitra Art Gallery, featuring a unique collection of traditional and contemporary paintings, including works of the legendary Raja Ravi Varma. Discover the Napier Museum, housing over 500 fascinating exhibits and 5,000+ coins, along with bronze idols, ivory carvings, and historical weapons. Wrap up your day and return to Kovalam for overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Departure from Trivandrum
itinerary.description: On your final day, wake up early to absorb all the beauty of Kerala one last time. Enjoy your hearty breakfast. Do some last-minute souvenir shopping, taking pieces of Kerala back home with you. Thereafter, our driver will take you to Trivandrum Airport or Railway Station, ending your wonderful Kerala trip with unforgettable memories of tea gardens, tranquil backwaters, and coastal serenity.

Pack lightweight cotton clothes, a light jacket, and comfortable walking shoes.
Beachwear for Kovalam and Varkala beaches.

itinerary.title: Arrival at Cochin – Scenic Drive to Munnar via Waterfalls
highlights: Arrival at Cochin Airport / Railway Station
itinerary.description: Your journey to the serene Kerala will begin as you reach the Cochin Airport or the railway station. From there, our driver will welcome you and take you to the Kashmir of the South, Munnar. In this 3-4 hour journey, enjoy the incredible Cheeyappara and Valara Waterfalls that will fall in your route. Click some soothing photos or take a quick bath in the fresh and chilly water of these waterfalls. You will also visit a beautiful spice garden. In the evening, you will reach your accommodation. Rest well to prepare yourself for the next day's exploration.

itinerary.title: Munnar Sightseeing – Dams, Lakes & National Park
itinerary.description: On the second day, you will get to know more about Munnar. So have your delicious breakfast and head to see the main attractions of this incredible place, Mattupetty Dam and Mattupetty Lake. Enjoy the pretty natural surroundings of the dam and a perennial lake that is immune to dry spells for the summer. Proceed to the gorgeous Kundala Lake, surrounded by greenery and beautiful vegetation. Then you will head to the Echo Point, located only 25 km from Munnar and situated over 600 feet above sea level. As the name sound, so does the place, you say anything and you will get to experience the echo phenomenon. You can also enjoy the scenic tea garden nearby. You will then discover the history and evolution of tea cultivation at the Tata Tea museum. Continue your journey to the famous Eravikulam National Park, located just a 25-minute drive from Munnar. Uncover this UNESCO World Heritage site, spot the unique animal species here endangered Nilgiri Tahr, the elusive lion-tailed macaque, the Atlas moth (the largest in the world), and a rare tiger or leopard. End today's sightseeing and return to your accommodation for a peaceful slumber.

itinerary.title: Munnar to Thekkady – Periyar Wildlife & Cultural Shows
itinerary.description: On the third day, rise early to enjoy your delicious breakfast. Then say goodbye to Munnar and head to the Spice Bag of Kerala, Thekkady. Enjoy the beautiful ride of almost four hours through the hills and valleys of the Western Ghats. Once you arrive, check into your hotel, rest for a while, and then start your exploration at Thekkady. Go to the Periyar National Park and Lake. If you are an animal lover, then this place is for you. Discover unique species at this tiger reserve. You can also simply sit in the serene Periyar Lake. Later, you will go to visit the Elephant camp, where you can directly interact with the elephant, either ride on them or feed them with your own hand. Then in the evening, entertain yourself with the Kathakali dance show and the Martial Arts show. Conclude your day by returning to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Thekkady to Alleppey – Venice of the South
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, you are going to visit another incredible attraction of Kerala, which is also known as the Venice of the South. So wake up early, have your fulfilling breakfast, and head to Alleppey, which will require almost five hours to reach here. Once you reach, check into your hotel and head to the Shri Krishna temple, a traditional Kerala-style temple. Don't miss the temple's famous rice pudding, known as the Pal payasam. You can also have fun at Alleppey beach, just stroll the coastline of the beach, or try the famous shikara ride here, in which you can discover the narrow canals and backwaters of this beautiful place. Wrap up your day and return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Alleppey to Cochin – Fort Kochi & Chinese Fishing Nets
itinerary.description: On this day, you will be going to explore Cochin. Wake up early, have your delicious breakfast, and say goodbye to Alleppey. On the way, you will discover Marari Beach, a village that gets its name from the local fishing village Mararikulam. Here you can simply sit on the beach or go fishing. Soon you will reach your hotel, relax for a while, and then head for sightseeing. You will visit the amazing Fort Kochi, a perfect historical and cultural place, the Dutch Palace (also known as Mattancherry Palace), a Portuguese palace where you can explore its stunning murals and intricate architecture. And finally, uncover the incredible Chinese Fishing Nets, to learn the fascinating ancient techniques to catch fish. End your exploration by coming back to your accommodation for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Departure from Cochin
itinerary.description: On the last day, wake up early to absorb all the beauty of Kerala. Then your hearty breakfast will be served. Enjoy your meal, and if time permits, you can do last-minute shopping for souvenirs, taking some pieces of Kerala with you. Thereafter, pack your bags and check out from the hotel. Our driver will take you to the airport or the railway station, ending your wonderful Kerala trip with unforgettable memories of God's Own Country.

itinerary.title: Arrival at Cochin – Scenic Drive to Munnar via Waterfalls
highlights: Arrival at Cochin Airport / Railway Station
itinerary.description: Your journey to the serene Kerala will begin as you reach the Cochin Airport or the railway station. From there, our driver will welcome you and take you to the Kashmir of the South, Munnar. In this 3-4 hour journey, enjoy the incredible Cheeyappara and Valara Waterfalls that will fall in your route. Click some soothing photos or take a quick bath in the fresh and chilly water of these waterfalls. You will also visit a beautiful spice garden. In the evening, you will reach your accommodation. Rest well to prepare yourself for the next day's exploration.

itinerary.title: Munnar Sightseeing – Dams, Lakes, Tea Museum & National Park
itinerary.description: On the second day, you will get to know more about Munnar. So have your delicious breakfast and head to see the main attractions of this incredible place, Mattupetty Dam and Mattupetty Lake. Enjoy the pretty natural surroundings of the dam and a perennial lake that is immune to dry spells for the summer. Proceed to the gorgeous Kundala Lake, surrounded by greenery and beautiful vegetation. Then you will head to the Echo Point, located only 25 km from Munnar and situated over 600 feet above sea level. As the name sound, so does the place, you say anything and you will get to experience the echo phenomenon. You can also enjoy the scenic tea garden nearby. You will then discover the history and evolution of tea cultivation at the Tata Tea museum. Continue your journey to the famous Eravikulam National Park, located just a 25-minute drive from Munnar. Uncover this UNESCO World Heritage site, spot the unique animal species here endangered Nilgiri Tahr, the elusive lion-tailed macaque, the Atlas moth (the largest in the world), and a rare tiger or leopard. End today's sightseeing and return to your accommodation for a peaceful slumber.

itinerary.title: Munnar to Alleppey – Venice of the South
itinerary.description: On the third day, rise early to enjoy your delicious breakfast. Then say goodbye to Munnar and head to the Venice of the South, Alleppey, which will require almost five hours to reach here. Once you reach, check into your hotel and head to the Shri Krishna temple, a traditional Kerala-style temple. Don't miss the temple's famous rice pudding, known as the Pal payasam. You can also have fun at Alleppey beach, just stroll the coastline of the beach, or try the famous shikara ride here, in which you can discover the narrow canals and backwaters of this beautiful place. Wrap up your day and return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Alleppey to Cochin – Departure via Marari Beach
itinerary.description: On the last day, wake up early to absorb all the beauty of Kerala. Then your hearty breakfast will be served. After enjoying your meal, check out from the hotel and head to Cochin airport via the beautiful Marari Beach. Relax by the shore, click some pictures, and soak in the coastal vibes. If time permits, you can do last-minute shopping for souvenirs, taking some pieces of Kerala with you. Thereafter, our driver will take you to the airport or the railway station, ending your wonderful Kerala trip with unforgettable memories of nature's best.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Expect warm days and cooler evenings in hill stations like Munnar.
Carry cotton clothes, a light jacket, and comfortable footwear.
An umbrella can come in handy during unexpected showers.
Light woolens recommended for Munnar evenings (November to February).

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: October to March – Ideal weather, pleasant temperatures, best for sightseeing.
April to May – Summer season, good for wildlife viewing.
June to September – Monsoon season, lush greenery and waterfalls at their best.
December to January – Peak tourist season, cooler temperatures.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Major cities and towns offer good mobile network and Wi-Fi.
Remote areas like forests and backwaters may have limited connectivity.
Use this as your digital detox opportunity.
Carry sufficient cash – ATMs may be limited in remote areas.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water
points: Kerala cuisine is rich in spices and coconut.
Must-try dishes: Appam with Stew, Puttu and Kadala Curry, Kerala Sadya.
Stick to bottled water for drinking.
Eat at trusted local restaurants or pre-recommended places.
Try authentic Kerala seafood in Alleppey.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Kerala is culturally rooted and traditional.
Dress modestly when visiting temples or local homes.
Always remove your shoes before entering sacred spaces.
Respect local customs and traditions.

keyInfo.title: Health Precautions
points: Carry basic medications and first aid kit.
If you're prone to motion sickness, take precautions for winding roads in Munnar.
Mosquito repellent is essential, especially in backwater areas.
Stay hydrated in the tropical climate.
Travel insurance strongly recommended.

keyInfo.title: Local Laws
points: Alcohol is regulated in Kerala – available only at government-approved shops or hotel bars.
Avoid consuming alcohol in public spaces.
Drugs are strictly prohibited.
Respect wildlife protection laws in national parks.
Follow designated trails in protected areas.

keyInfo.title: Eco-Responsibility
points: Help us preserve Kerala's natural beauty.
Avoid single-use plastics – carry reusable water bottles.
Don't litter in nature spots, backwaters, or hill stations.
Respect wildlife zones – maintain safe distance from animals.
Take only memories, leave only footprints.

points: Light cotton clothes and a light jacket for evenings
Comfortable walking shoes for sightseeing
Swimwear (for beach activities)
Sunscreen, sunglasses, sunhat
Mosquito repellent
Umbrella or raincoat (especially during monsoon)
Basic medications and motion sickness pills
Camera to capture scenic beauty

destinations.description: Ladakh, the most beautiful region of North India, also known as 'the Land of High Passes', is located in northern India and is famous for its alluring terrain, unique culture, ancient monasteries, and numerous options for adventure sports. Nestled between the Karakoram and Himalayan mountain ranges, this cold desert offers breathtaking landscapes, from turquoise lakes to sand dunes, and from world's highest motorable passes to centuries-old Buddhist monasteries.

packages.title: Ladakh: A Journey Through the Land of High Passes

price.per: Per Person on twin sharing basis

highlights: Experience the world's highest motorable road – Khardung La Pass (18,380 ft)
Camp beside the mesmerizing Pangong Lake, famous for changing colors
Ride double-humped Bactrian camels on Hunder Sand Dunes, Nubra Valley
Visit Diskit Monastery with its iconic 106-ft Maitreya Buddha statue
Witness Magnetic Hill where vehicles appear to move uphill by themselves
Confluence of Zanskar & Indus rivers at Sangam
Explore Hanley – one of the world's highest astronomical observation sites
Drive through Sham Valley, Gurudwara Pathar Sahib & Hall of Fame
Experience Ladakhi culture, monasteries, and high-altitude desert landscapes
inclusions: Accommodation for 6 nights: 3 nights in Leh, 1 night in Nubra Valley camp, 1 night in Pangong camp, 1 night in Hanley camp/homestay
Rooms on double/triple sharing basis
6 Breakfasts & 6 Dinners
Transfers by Tempo Traveller/Innova/Xylo from Leh to Leh
All Inner Line permits for the trip
Parking fees, toll taxes, driver's night charges
24-hour oxygen cylinder in vehicle for emergency
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
exclusions: Any food or drink not mentioned – alcoholic beverages, mineral water, highway lunches, refreshments
Personal expenses: tips for drivers, monument/monastery entry fees, camera/video charges
Adventure activities: river rafting, camel safari, trekking, mountain biking
Any expenses resulting from natural disasters, landslides, roadblocks, etc
Anything not specifically mentioned under Inclusions

itinerary.title: Arrival in Leh – Acclimatization & Rest
itinerary.description: On the first day, you will arrive at Leh, known as the 'Land of High Passes'. After arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy a delicious dinner in this Himalayan paradise. Today is reserved for rest and acclimatization to the high altitude (11,562 ft). Take a gentle stroll in the nearby markets if you feel comfortable. Get some sound sleep to prepare yourself to kickstart the Ladakh adventure the next day.

itinerary.title: Leh Sightseeing – Magnetic Hill, Sangam & Sham Valley
highlights: Sangam – Confluence of Zanskar & Indus rivers
itinerary.description: After a hearty breakfast, begin your Ladakh adventure by exploring the top attractions of Leh. Visit the Hall of Fame, a museum dedicated to Indian soldiers. Proceed to Gurudwara Shri Pathar Sahib, commemorating Guru Nanak's visit. Continue through Sham Valley and witness the magical Magnetic Hill, where vehicles appear to move uphill by themselves. Visit Sangam, the breathtaking confluence of Zanskar and Indus rivers. In the evening, head back to Leh to discover delightful local markets and lovely cafes. Wrap up your day with a flavourful dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Leh to Nubra Valley – Khardung La & Hunder Sand Dunes
highlights: Khardung La Pass – World's highest motorable road (18,380 ft)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, prepare for an exhilarating drive to Nubra Valley via Khardung La Pass, the world's highest motorable road at 18,380 feet. Enjoy refreshment breaks at South and North Pullu. Visit the magnificent Diskit Monastery, home to the famous 106-ft Maitreya Buddha statue overlooking the valley. Continue to the fascinating Hunder Sand Dunes, where cold desert meets sand. Opt for an exciting camel ride on the rare double-humped Bactrian camels at your own cost. Relive today's adventure over a satisfying meal and overnight stay at Nubra Valley camp.

itinerary.title: Nubra Valley to Pangong Lake – Shyok River & Blue Waters
itinerary.description: Enjoy breakfast before heading to the iconic Pangong Lake from Nubra Valley. The drive takes you along the serene Shyok River – don't forget to capture the beautiful river views. Upon arrival at Pangong Lake, witness the magical lake that changes colors throughout the day – from azure blue to emerald green and deep grey. Camp beside the lake to experience the calmness of this nature's gift. Conclude your day with a satisfying dinner before retiring to your camp for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Pangong to Hanley – World's Highest Astronomical Site
itinerary.description: After finishing your breakfast, transfer from Pangong to Hanley, one of the highest locations in the world for astronomical observation. Upon arrival, get absorbed in the peaceful Hanley River and surrounding landscape. This remote village offers breathtaking views of the night sky, making it a paradise for stargazers. Enjoy snacks en route and absorb the tranquility. Return to Hanley camp/homestay for a satisfying dinner and overnight accommodation.

itinerary.title: Hanley to Leh – Return to Civilization
itinerary.description: On the sixth day, begin your journey from Hanley back to the wonderful city of Leh. En route, explore traditional Ladakhi villages, interact with locals, and capture photographs of the stunning landscapes. Take your time with photography stops and pause occasionally to enjoy your packed goodies. Arrive in Leh by evening, check into your hotel, and spend a relaxing night. Enjoy your final dinner in Ladakh with memories of incredible adventures.

itinerary.title: Departure from Leh
itinerary.description: Enjoy a great breakfast amidst Ladakh's breathtaking scenery as your adventure through the Land of High Passes comes to an end. Pack your bags and gather your belongings with a heart full of wonderful memories and adventures. After checking out from the hotel, proceed to Leh Airport to begin your journey back home, carrying with you the magic of the Himalayas.

keyInfo.title: High Altitude & Acclimatization
points: Leh is at an altitude of 11,562 feet (3,524 m) above sea level.
Altitude sickness is common – consult your doctor before traveling.
Day 1 is strictly for rest and acclimatization – no sightseeing.
Avoid alcohol and smoking on the first day.
Stay hydrated – drink plenty of water.
Carry Diamox (altitude sickness medication) after consulting your doctor.
If you experience severe headache, nausea, or breathlessness, inform your guide immediately.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: June to September – Peak season, pleasant weather, all roads open.
May and October – Shoulder season, fewer crowds, budget-friendly.
December to February – Extreme cold (-20°C to -30°C), Chadar Trek season.
March to April – Cold but beautiful, some passes still closed.
July-August – Green Ladakh, blooming flowers, Nubra and Pangong at their best.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Day temperature: 20°C to 30°C in summer, 0°C to 10°C in winter.
Night temperature: 5°C to 10°C in summer, -15°C to -30°C in winter.
Summer: Pack lightweight woolens, thermals, fleece jacket, windcheater.
Winter: Heavy woolens, multiple layers, down jacket, thermal inners, monkey cap, gloves.
Sturdy waterproof trekking shoes are essential.
Sunscreen, sunglasses, and lip balm are mandatory – UV rays are strong at high altitude.

keyInfo.title: Permits
points: Indian citizens require Inner Line Permits (ILP) for Nubra, Pangong, and Hanley.
Travel Junky facilitates all Inner Line permits as part of the package.
Carry original government ID (Aadhar, Voter ID, Passport) and 2 passport-size photos.
Foreign nationals require Protected Area Permit (PAP) and must travel in groups of 2+.
Permit fees are subject to change as per government regulations.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: BSNL and Airtel work in Leh town (4G).
Jio has limited connectivity in Leh.
Nubra Valley, Pangong, and Hanley have very poor or no network.
Wi-Fi is available in select hotels in Leh (paid).
Embrace digital detox – inform family and friends beforehand.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water
points: Ladakhi cuisine: Thukpa (noodle soup), Momos, Skyu, Butter Tea.
North Indian, Chinese, and Continental food available in Leh.
Stick to bottled or filtered water.
Avoid heavy, oily food on the first day.
Carry energy bars, dry fruits, and chocolates for long drives.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Sensitivity
points: Ladakh is known as 'Little Tibet' – home to Tibetan Buddhism.
Respect local customs and traditions.
Walk clockwise around stupas, monasteries, and prayer wheels.
Remove shoes before entering monastery prayer halls.
Ask permission before photographing monks and locals.
Dress modestly, especially in religious sites.

keyInfo.title: Unique Landscapes
points: Ladakh offers incredible diversity – cold desert, sand dunes, turquoise lakes, snow peaks.
Nubra Valley – Cold desert with sand dunes and Bactrian camels.
Pangong TSO – Chameleon lake, changes color from blue to green to grey.
TSO Moriri – Protected wetland, less crowded, equally beautiful.
Khardung La – World's highest motorable road (18,380 ft).
Umla La – Another high mountain pass on the way to Hanley.

keyInfo.title: Safety & Health
points: Ladakh is a cold desert with harsh climatic conditions.
Carry a basic first aid kit with pain relievers, antiseptic, bandages.
Motion sickness pills recommended for winding mountain roads.
24-hour oxygen cylinder available in vehicle for emergencies.
Travel insurance is strongly recommended.
Be cautious in remote areas – inform your driver/guide if unwell.

keyInfo.title: Pre-Travel Planning
points: Book at least 30-45 days in advance during peak season (June-September).
Choose a reliable travel agency like Travel Junky for stress-free experience.
Share your itinerary with friends and family.
Keep digital and physical copies of all documents.
Carry sufficient cash – ATMs are limited and often non-functional in remote areas.
Check weather and road conditions before departure.

keyInfo.title: Packing Essentials

packages.title: Beyond the Peaks: A Ladakh, Manali & Srinagar Odyssey

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Epic 10-day odyssey covering Ladakh, Manali & Srinagar
Overnight Volvo journey from Delhi to Manali
Visit Hadimba Temple and explore Mall Road in Manali
Drive through Atal Tunnel - world's longest highway tunnel
Experience camping at Jispa under starry skies
Traverse the legendary Manali-Leh Highway with 21 steep turns
Visit Hall of Fame, Magnetic Hill, Gurudwara Pathar Sahib & Sangam Point
Cross Khardungla Pass - world's highest motorable road
Ride Bactrian camels at Nubra Valley's Hunder Sand Dunes
Witness the mesmerizing color-changing Pangong Lake
Cross Chang La Pass, Fotu La, Namika La & Zoji La
Experience the coldest inhabited place - Drass
Stay in traditional houseboat on Dal Lake, Srinagar
Perfect blend of adventure, culture & Himalayan beauty
inclusions: Transfers in Volvo from Delhi to Manali
Transfers in Traveller / Innova / Xylo for entire journey
Accommodation for 9 nights: 1 night Manali hotel, 1 night Jispa camp, 3 nights Leh hotel, 1 night Nubra camp, 1 night Pangong camp, 1 night Kargil hotel, 1 night Srinagar hotel
Accommodation on double/triple sharing basis
Total 18 Meals: Dinner on Day 2, Breakfast+Dinner on Days 3,4,5,6,7,8,9, and Breakfast on Day 10
All meals served on fixed menu
All Inner Line permits for the trip
Parking fees, toll taxes, driver's night fees
24-hour oxygen cylinder in vehicle for emergency
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
Travel assistance by Travel Junky Experts
exclusions: Any food or drink not mentioned - alcoholic beverages, mineral water, highway lunches, refreshments
Personal expenses - gratuities for drivers, monument/monastery entry fees, camera/video charges
Adventure activities - river rafting, camel safari, ATV rides
Any expenses resulting from natural disasters, landslides, roadblocks (to be paid immediately by client)
Anything not specifically mentioned under Inclusions

itinerary.title: Departure from Delhi – Overnight Volvo to Manali
itinerary.description: On the first day of your Ladakh tour package, our bus will be waiting for you in the evening at Delhi. Get on the bus, settle into your comfortable seats. As the music starts playing, another kind of thrill will rush into you. In this 12-hour journey from Delhi to Manali, feel the cool breeze, watch the bright stars, and stop at the dhabas for revitalizing snacks. Live each moment until you reach Manali.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Manali – Hadimba Temple & Mall Road
itinerary.description: In the dawn, around 5-7 AM, you will arrive at Manali, the Valley of Gods. Our driver will transfer you to your hotel. Settle in your accommodation, take in the fresh air of the mountain, and unwind from this 560 km long journey from Delhi to Manali. After unwinding, explore the nearby towns, visit Hadimba Temple for a spiritual walk, and you can buy Himachali Handicrafts from Mall Road. Conclude the day by having a scrumptious dinner and a peaceful slumber at your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Manali to Jispa – Atal Tunnel & Scenic Valleys
highlights: Atal Tunnel - world's longest highway tunnel
itinerary.description: Rise and shine in this beautiful scenery of Manali. A hearty breakfast will be served early in the morning. And after the short briefing about the trip, you will be all set to uncover the new destination, Jispa. Enjoy this travelling time of 5-7 hours in the car as you pass through the longest highway tunnel in the world, the Atal Tunnel, stunning villages like Keylong, and Sisu. Keep your phone and camera charged to capture all the picturesque views. Around 4-5 PM in the evening, you will reach the charming village of Jispa, a small but beautiful village surrounded by greenery and a peaceful environment. Here, check into your amazing camp location and as the sun sets, relish the lively night music. Fun is still not over, after that enjoy the mouth-watering dinner and have a good night's sleep at your camp under the starry night.

itinerary.title: Jispa to Leh – Manali-Leh Highway & High Altitude Passes
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, wake up early to enjoy the warmth of Jispa for the last time. After having a fulfilling breakfast, you will venture out to discover majestic Leh. In this 95 km journey through the Manali-Leh Highway, experience the 21 steep turns, gorgeous views of high-altitude places such as Darcha, a peaceful mountain village, Zing Zing Bar, the highest roadside dhaba, and Baralacha, a high mountain pass. You will also get the opportunity to enjoy the self-paying lunch at the high-altitude village, Sarchu, in the afternoon. You will enter scenic Leh around 7 pm in the evening. Relax at your hotel and unwind with a delicious dinner. After that, recharge yourself by getting a good sleep for the next day's excitement.

itinerary.title: Leh Sightseeing – Hall of Fame, Magnetic Hill & Sangam Point
itinerary.description: On this fifth day, you will visit the main attractions of Leh. Thus, have a fulfilling breakfast, prepare yourself for today's journey, packed with beauty, adventure, and history. Visit Hall of Fame, a stunning museum dedicated to Indian soldiers, Gurudwara Shri Pathar Sahib, a spiritual site built in memory of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, Sangam Point where Zanskar and Indus rivers meet, Magnetic Hill where cars seem to drive themselves uphill, and Sham Valley, also known as Apricot Valley. Then in the evening, our driver will bring you back. Explore the local marketplace and aesthetic cafes of Leh. Then, make your day more happening with a tasty dinner and a peaceful slumber in the hotel.

itinerary.title: Leh to Nubra Valley – Khardungla Pass & Hunder Sand Dunes
highlights: Khardungla Pass - world's highest motorable road
itinerary.description: On the sixth day, you will uncover the orchard of Ladakh: the Nubra Valley. After having the revitalizing breakfast, get ready to start the 7-hour journey from Leh to Nubra Valley. Be sure to immerse yourself in every view that comes in route: Khardungla Pass, the world's highest motorable road, Diskit Monastery, the oldest and largest monastery. Stop at North Pullu and South Pullu for delicious refreshments. And as you reach the fascinating Hunder Sand Dunes, don't forget to enjoy the ATV rides on the white sands and exciting camel ride on the unique Bactrian camel hump for which Nubra valley is known for (at your own expense). End the adventurous day by having a mouthwatering dinner and a peaceful sleep at your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Nubra to Pangong Lake – Shyok River & Color-Changing Lake
itinerary.description: On the seventh day, have breakfast before setting off to Pangong Lake from Nubra Valley. As you drive toward the lake, you'll pass the peaceful Shyok River. Be sure to stop and take in the views of this shimmering blue water. Upon reaching Pangong Lake, situated around 13,680ft stretches across India and China. Here, get amazed by witnessing the quality of the river to change color throughout the day. Then be enthusiastic about the camp stay, which is just 200-300m away from Pangong Lake. Finally, wrap up your day with a satisfying dinner before retiring for the night.

itinerary.title: Pangong to Leh – Sunrise at Pangong & Chang La Pass
highlights: Chang La Pass - 3rd highest motorable road
itinerary.description: On this day, wake up early to see the soothing Sunrise at Pangong Lake, that adrenaline you will see when the river beautifully mirrors the yellow sun. Enjoy your last day at Pangong Lake by walking around the shoreline and listening to the stillness of the river. After that, come back to your campsite to enjoy the delicious breakfast. After that, you will depart from Pangong and your seven-hour drive will begin to Leh, where you will cross the remarkable Chang La Pass, the third-highest motorable road. As you journey, take pleasure in the stunning views while sipping tea or coffee, or simply admire the sights and inhale the fresh air. By the evening, you'll reach Leh, settle into your hotel, and relax with a delightful dinner.

itinerary.title: Leh to Kargil – Mulbek, Namika La & Fotu La
highlights: Namika La (Pillar of the Sky Pass)
Fotu La - highest point on Srinagar-Leh highway
itinerary.description: On this day, you will cover the new historic destination of Kargil. So, after having a satisfying breakfast, embark on the 5-6 hour journey from Leh to Kargil. You will pass through Mulbek, a small village famous for its monasteries and statue of Maitreya Buddha, Namika La, a high-altitude mountain pass also known as the Pillar of the Sky Pass, and Fotu La, the highest point on the Srinagar-Leh highway. In the late evening, you will reach Kargil, absorb the uniqueness of this place, and before getting comfortable in the bed at your hotel, savour the delicious dinner.

itinerary.title: Kargil to Srinagar – Sonmarg, Drass & Zoji La
highlights: Zoji La Pass - gateway to Ladakh
itinerary.description: As your Ladakh tour package nears its end, so does the excitement of covering a unique destination. Therefore, on this day, you will discover Srinagar, also known as the Venice of the East. So fuel yourself with a mouthwatering breakfast and venture out to uncover this new journey. In your route, you will be mesmerized by seeing the beauty of Sonmarg, also called the Meadow of Gold, experience the extreme chill of the second coldest inhabited place in the world, Drass, and stop at Zoji La Pass, the gateway to Ladakh, to click the aesthetic picture of stunning views. Then in the evening, you will reach Srinagar. Upon arriving, enjoy your traditional houseboat surrounded by the Zabarwan hills in the serene Dal Lake. And before hitting the bed at your hotel, enjoy the delicious dinner that is being served.

itinerary.title: Departure from Srinagar
itinerary.description: On this last day, relish your breakfast with a stunning view of Srinagar Lake and the garden. After that, pack your bags and head to the Airport. As soon as your flight approaches, bid adieu to Srinagar and fly back to your home with souvenirs in your bag, a mind full of stories, and experiences that will last long.

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Visit Hall of Fame, Magnetic Hill, Sangam Point & Gurudwara Pathar Sahib
Cross Khardungla Pass - world's highest motorable road
Explore Nubra Valley's Hunder Sand Dunes with Bactrian camel ride
Witness the mesmerizing color-changing Pangong Lake
Visit ancient Diskit Monastery with Maitreya Buddha statue
Cross Chang La Pass - third highest motorable road
Shop for traditional Ladakhi items at Leh local markets
Perfect blend of adventure, spirituality & Himalayan magic
inclusions: Transfers in Tempo / Innova / Xylo from Leh to Leh
Accommodation for 5 nights: 3 nights Leh hotel, 1 night Nubra camp, 1 night Pangong camp
Accommodation on double/triple sharing basis
6 Breakfasts and 6 Dinners
All Inner Line permits for the trip
Parking fees, toll taxes, driver's night fees
24-hour oxygen cylinder in vehicle for emergency
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
Travel assistance by Travel Junky Experts

itinerary.title: Arrival in Leh – Acclimatization & Local Exploration
itinerary.description: On the first day of your Ladakh trip, you will arrive at Leh, the region of high passes. After entering the adventurous city, check into your hotel. Let your body settle in this high-altitude terrain. After that, enjoy a delicious dinner in this Himalayan paradise. After that, get some sound sleep to prepare yourself to feel the magic of this Union Territory the next day.

itinerary.title: Leh Sightseeing – Hall of Fame, Magnetic Hill & Sangam Point
highlights: Traditional Thukpa & Momos at local cafes
itinerary.description: On the second day of your tour, here comes time to begin your Ladakh adventure. Have a revitalizing breakfast and start the thrill by exploring the top attractions of Leh. You will visit the Hall of Fame, a military museum dedicated to Indian soldiers, especially those who fought in the Kargil war, Gurudwara Shri Pathar Sahib, a spiritual site, Sham Valley, a picturesque village known for its apricots, Sangam point, where Zanskar and Indus rivers meet, and the magical Magnetic Hill, where vehicles appear to move uphill by themselves. In the evening, you will head back to Leh to discover the delightful local markets from where you can shop traditional Ladakhi items, from Ladakhi jewelry to Pashmina shawls. Head to the lovely cafes to taste the traditional Thukpa and momos. Then wrap your day with a flavourful dinner and a night stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Leh to Nubra Valley – Khardungla Pass & Hunder Sand Dunes
highlights: Khardungla Pass - world's highest motorable road
itinerary.description: On your third day, prepare to tour Nubra Valley from Leh after a delicious breakfast. Here you will visit exciting places like Khardung La Pass, the world's highest motorable road, the magnificent Diskit Monastery, which houses the famous Maitreya Buddha statue, and the interesting Hunder Sand Dunes. In addition to enjoying some refreshments at South and North Pullu. You can have an exciting camel ride on the famous double-humped Bactrian camels at your own cost. At the end of the day, relive today's adventure over a satisfying meal and overnight stay at Nubra Valley.

itinerary.title: Nubra to Pangong Lake – Shyok River & Color-Changing Lake
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, enjoy a satisfying breakfast before heading to Pangong Lake from Nubra Valley. While you will be driving toward this lake, you will pass another serene Shyok River, a tributary of the Indus River. Don't forget to see and capture the view of this beautiful river. Once you arrive at Pangong Lake, you will be amazed by the changing color of the lake from blue to green, sometimes even red, for which this lake is known. Fun is not over yet, get into your campsite location beside the lake to witness the calmness of this nature's gift. Then, conclude your day by taking a satisfying dinner before hitting the bed.

itinerary.title: Pangong to Leh – Sunrise at Pangong & Chang La Pass
highlights: Chang La Pass - 3rd highest motorable road
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, you will head back to Leh from Pangong. Thus, after having a mouthwatering breakfast, last time capture the beauty of this lake, walk on the shoreline, or play with the water. Finally, venture back to Leh. Enjoy your drive by listening to music, hearing the chirping of birds, and simply looking outside the window. In your route, you will pass Chang La Pass, the third-highest motorable mountain pass in the world. Capture this moment. In the evening, you will arrive at Leh, explore the village, and spend some quality time there. At last, hit the bed at your accommodation after having a delicious dinner.

itinerary.title: Departure from Leh
itinerary.description: On this day, at the end of your domestic package, enjoy a great breakfast in the midst of Ladakh's breathtaking scenery. After that, pack your bags and gather all of your possessions with a heart full of wonderful memories and adventures. After leaving the hotel, proceed to the Leh airport to begin your journey back home.

packages.title: Ladakh Discovery: Journey Through the Land of High Passes

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Perfect 6 Nights / 7 Days Ladakh discovery journey
Visit Hall of Fame, Magnetic Hill, Sangam Point & Gurudwara Pathar Sahib
Cross Khardungla Pass - world's highest motorable road
Explore Nubra Valley's Hunder Sand Dunes with Bactrian camel ride
Visit Turtuk - northernmost village of India with unique Balti culture
Witness the mesmerizing color-changing Pangong Lake
Visit ancient Diskit Monastery with Maitreya Buddha statue
Cross Chang La Pass - third highest motorable road
Immerse in local Balti culture and interact with warm-hearted locals
Perfect blend of adventure, spirituality & offbeat exploration
inclusions: Transfers in Tempo/SUV from Leh to Leh
Accommodation for 6 nights: 3 nights Leh hotel, 2 nights Nubra camp, 1 night Pangong camp
Accommodation on double/triple sharing basis
6 Breakfasts and 6 Dinners
All Inner Line permits for the trip
Parking fees, toll taxes, driver's night fees
24-hour oxygen cylinder in vehicle for emergency
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
Travel assistance by Travel Junky Experts

Personal expenses - gratuities for drivers, monument/monastery entry fees, camera/video charges
Adventure activities - river rafting, camel safari, ATV rides
Any expenses resulting from natural disasters, landslides, roadblocks (to be paid immediately by client)
Anything not specifically mentioned under Inclusions

itinerary.title: Arrival in Leh – Acclimatization & Local Exploration
itinerary.description: On the first day, you will land in Leh, the area of high passes. Go to your accommodation as soon as you arrive and take in the splendor of this great elevation. Enjoy a cozy and friendly dinner in the evening before resting at your accommodation to start your trip to Ladakh the following day.

itinerary.title: Leh Sightseeing – Hall of Fame, Magnetic Hill & Sangam Point
itinerary.description: On this second day, you will visit the main attractions of Leh, packed with beauty, adventure, and history. Prepare yourself for today by having a fulfilling breakfast. Discover Leh, Visit Hall of Fame, a stunning museum dedicated to Indian soldiers, Gurudwara Shri Pathar Sahib, a spiritual site built in memory of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, Sangam Point where Zanskar and Indus rivers meet, Magnetic Hill where cars seem to drive themselves uphill, and Sham Valley, also known as Apricot Valley. Then in the evening, our driver will bring you back. Explore the local marketplace and aesthetic cafes of Leh. Then, make your day more happening with a tasty dinner and a peaceful slumber in the hotel.

itinerary.title: Leh to Nubra Valley – Khardungla Pass & Hunder Sand Dunes
highlights: Khardungla Pass - world's highest motorable road
itinerary.description: On the third day, you will uncover the orchard of Ladakh: the Nubra Valley. After having the revitalizing breakfast, get ready to start the 7-hour journey from Leh to Nubra Valley. Be sure to immerse yourself in every view that comes in route: Khardungla Pass, the world's highest motorable road, Diskit Monastery, the oldest and largest monastery. Stop at North Pullu and South Pullu for delicious refreshments. And as you reach the fascinating Hunder Sand Dunes, don't forget to enjoy the ATV rides on the white sands and exciting camel ride on the unique Bactrian camel hump for which Nubra valley is known for (at your own expense). End the adventurous day by having a mouthwatering dinner and a peaceful sleep at your accommodation.

itinerary.title: Nubra to Turtuk – Northernmost Village of India
itinerary.description: Once breakfast is finished, get ready to wander Turtuk, a hidden gem in the Shyok River. Turtuk, the northernmost village of India, is one of the four Balti settlements ruled by India and one of the Siachen Glacier's entrances, too. Here, explore the neighborhood, learn about Balti culture, and converse with the welcoming locals. Once you're back in Nubra Valley, eat dinner and get a good night's sleep in the hotel.

itinerary.title: Nubra to Pangong Lake – Shyok River & Color-Changing Lake
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, have breakfast before setting off to Pangong Lake from Nubra Valley. As you drive toward the lake, you'll pass the peaceful Shyok River. Be sure to stop and take in the views of this shimmering blue water. Upon reaching Pangong Lake, situated around 13,680ft stretches across India and China. Here, get amazed by witnessing the quality of the river to change color throughout the day. Then be enthusiastic about the camp stay, which is just 200-300m away from Pangong Lake. Finally, wrap up your day with a satisfying dinner before retiring for the night.

itinerary.title: Pangong to Leh – Sunrise at Pangong & Chang La Pass
highlights: Chang La Pass - 3rd highest motorable road
itinerary.description: On this day, wake up early to see the soothing Sunrise at Pangong Lake, feel that adrenaline when you see the river beautifully mirror the yellow sun. Enjoy your last day at Pangong Lake by walking around the shoreline and listening to the stillness of the river. After that, come back to your campsite to enjoy the delicious breakfast. After that, withdraw from Pangong and start your seven-hour drive to Leh, where you will pass the remarkable Chang La Pass, the third-highest motorable road. As you journey, take pleasure in the stunning views while sipping tea or coffee, or simply admire the sights and inhale the fresh air. By the evening, you'll reach Leh, settle into your hotel, and relax with a delightful dinner.

itinerary.title: Departure from Leh
itinerary.description: On this day, at the end of your domestic tour package, enjoy a great breakfast in the midst of Ladakh's breathtaking scenery. After that, pack your bags and gather all of your possessions with a heart full of wonderful memories and adventures. After leaving the hotel, proceed to the Leh airport to begin your journey back home.

keyInfo.title: High Altitude and Acclimatization
points: The altitude of Ladakh is 11,562 feet above sea level.
Some travelers can suffer from altitude sickness.
Visit a doctor before making any plan.
Let your body adapt slowly to the lower oxygen conditions.
Drink plenty of water and avoid alcohol during first few days.
Day 1 is kept free for proper acclimatization.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: June to September – Ideal weather, all passes open, best for road trips.
May to June – Pleasant temperatures, blooming flowers.
July to August – Peak tourist season, clear skies.
October – Pre-winter, less crowd, cold nights.
November to April – Heavy snowfall, most passes closed.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Sensitivity
points: Ladakh is also known as Little Tibet.
Home to Tibetan Buddhists with numerous monasteries.
Be mindful of local culture and traditions.
Walk clockwise around stupas and prayer wheels.
Ask permission before photographing monks or locals.
Turtuk has unique Balti culture - be respectful and curious.

keyInfo.title: Unique Landscapes
points: Situated between Karakoram and Himalayan ranges.
Unique landscape from coldest deserts to snow peaks.
Stunning valleys like Nubra Valley.
Blue lakes like Pangong TSO (chameleon lake).
World's highest motorable passes - Khardungla & Chang La.
Turtuk offers a glimpse into Baltistan's green oasis.

keyInfo.title: Pre-Travel Planning
points: Plan your visit prior, especially for peak season.
Choose a reliable and reputable travel agency.
Keep friends and family updated during your trip.
Book accommodation in advance during peak months.
Check road conditions and pass openings before travel.

keyInfo.title: Safety and Health
points: Ladakh is known as the coldest desert.
Cold and harsh climatic conditions with chilly winds.
Carry a basic first aid kit and emergency supplies.
Pack extra food and water for remote areas.
Use lip balm and moisturizer to prevent dryness.
Wear sunscreen even on cloudy days due to high UV radiation.

destinations.description: Meghalaya, meaning 'Abode of Clouds' in Sanskrit, is one of the seven North-Eastern states of India. Famous for its high rainfall, subtropical forests, living root bridges, and biodiversity, it is abutted by Assam in the north and east and by Bangladesh in the south. The state's territory constituted the Khasi-Jaintia Hills and Garo Hills districts of Assam until 1972. Most of the terrain is hilly and experiences heavy rainfall during monsoons, creating lush green landscapes, countless waterfalls, and unique ecosystems found nowhere else in the world.

packages.title: Meghalaya: Abode of Clouds – Waterfalls, Root Bridges & Culture

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Visit Umiam Lake – one of the largest artificial lakes in Meghalaya
Explore Cherrapunjee (Sohra) – one of the wettest places on Earth
Witness Nohkalikai Falls – India's tallest plunge waterfall
Trek to Umshiang Double Decker Living Root Bridge (3,500 steps)
Swim at Wei-Sawdong Waterfalls – the highest plunge falls in India
Visit Asia's cleanest village – Mawphalang Sacred Grove
Experience Indo-Bangladesh border at Dwaki with crystal clear water boat ride
Explore Mawsmai Cave, Arwah Cave & Seven Sisters Falls
Camp beside lake at Shnongpdawng with bonfire
inclusions: 02 nights accommodation in Shillong
02 nights accommodation in Cherrapunjee
01 night accommodation in Shnongpdawng (lake campsite)
5 Breakfasts & 5 Dinners (Fixed Menu)
All toll taxes and parking fees
All sightseeing and transfers by SUV / Traveller

itinerary.title: Arrival in Guwahati – Transfer to Shillong via Umiam Lake
itinerary.description: Arrive at Lokpriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport, Guwahati before noon. Our tour representative will receive you and transfer you to Shillong (vehicle departs at 12:30 PM). En route, visit Umiam Lake, one of the largest artificial lakes in Meghalaya, and enjoy boating in its serene waters. Continue your journey and reach Shillong by evening. Check into your hotel and freshen up. Take a leisurely stroll at Police Bazar (like Mall Road) for shopping and local snacks. Overnight stay at hotel in Shillong.

itinerary.title: Shillong to Cherrapunjee – Valleys, Caves & Waterfalls
itinerary.description: After breakfast, check out from the hotel around 10:00 AM and drive to Cherrapunjee, locally known as Sohra – one of the wettest places on Earth. En route, visit Mawkdok Dympep Valley View Point for breathtaking panoramic views. Upon reaching Cherrapunjee, explore Wahkabah Falls, Arwah Cave with its limestone formations, Nohkalikai Falls – India's tallest plunge waterfall, Mawsmai Cave – a beautifully lit limestone cave, and the Seven Sisters Waterfalls. Cherrapunjee's abundant natural beauty, valleys, waterfalls, caves, and evergreen misty landscapes will leave you spellbound. Overnight stay in Cherrapunjee.

itinerary.title: Wei-Sawdong Waterfalls & Double Decker Root Bridge
highlights: Wei-Sawdong Waterfalls – swim in the highest plunge falls
Umshiang Double Decker Living Root Bridge (3,500 steps)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, drive to Wei-Sawdong Waterfalls, the highest plunge falls in India. You can swim in the crystal clear natural pools here – a truly refreshing experience. Next, proceed to the famous Umshiang Double Decker Living Root Bridge, an engineering marvel of nature. This trek involves approximately 3,500 steps on one side, but the effort is rewarded with one of Meghalaya's most iconic sights. If you prefer a less strenuous option, you can visit Tempu Waterfalls instead. Return to your hotel by evening. Overnight stay in Cherrapunjee.

itinerary.title: Single Root Bridge – Mawphalang Village – Dwaki Border
highlights: Mawphalang Village Sacred Grove – Asia's cleanest village
Boat ride on crystal clear water
itinerary.description: After breakfast, check out from the hotel by 9:00 AM. En route, visit a Single Root Bridge, another living root bridge creation. Then head to Mawphalang Village Sacred Grove, a perfect representation of Khasi culture and beliefs, also known as Asia's cleanest village. Later, proceed to Dwaki at the Indo-Bangladesh border and enjoy a boat ride on the stunning crystal clear waters (at your own expense). Transfer to Shnongpdawng village and check into your lakeside campsite. Enjoy a bonfire in the evening under the starry sky. Overnight stay at Shnongpdawng lake campsite.

itinerary.title: Adventure Activities & Return to Shillong
itinerary.description: After breakfast, get ready for adventure activities by 8:00 AM (available at your own expense). Check out from the campsite around 11:00 AM and return to Shillong. Check into your hotel and freshen up. The evening is free for you to explore Shillong city on your own. This is your last night of the trip – don't forget to buy souvenirs, local handicrafts, and Khasi traditional items from Police Bazar or Bara Bazar. Overnight stay at hotel in Shillong.

itinerary.title: Departure from Shillong – Transfer to Guwahati Airport
itinerary.description: After breakfast, we will assist you with transfers to Lokpriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport, Guwahati. Depart from Shillong at 10:00 AM. Please book your return flights from Guwahati after 2:30 PM to allow sufficient travel time. Fly back home with beautiful memories of Meghalaya's waterfalls, living root bridges, caves, and warm Khasi hospitality.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: October to April – Pleasant weather, clear skies, ideal for sightseeing and trekking.
May to September – Monsoon season, Cherrapunjee receives highest rainfall, waterfalls at full glory, but roadblocks possible.
November to February – Winter, cold mornings and evenings, perfect for camping and bonfire.
July-August – Living root bridges are lush green, but trekking can be slippery.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Summer (March-June): 15°C to 28°C – Light cottons, raincoat/umbrella.
Winter (November-February): 4°C to 18°C – Heavy woolens, jackets, sweaters, gloves.
Monsoon (July-September): Heavy rainfall – Waterproof jackets, umbrellas, quick-dry clothing.
Sturdy trekking shoes with good grip are essential for root bridge treks.
Carry flip-flops for campsite and water activities.

keyInfo.title: Living Root Bridges – Trekking Information
points: Umshiang Double Decker Root Bridge – 3,500+ steps one way, 2-3 hours trek.
Single Root Bridge – Less strenuous, shorter trek.
Wear comfortable trekking shoes with good grip.
Carry water, energy bars, and light snacks.
Start early to avoid afternoon heat and crowds.
Hire local guides (available at trek starting points) for better experience.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Shillong has decent 4G coverage (Jio, Airtel, BSNL).
Cherrapunjee has limited connectivity in some areas.
Remote villages and trekking areas may have no network.
Wi-Fi available at select hotels in Shillong and Cherrapunjee.
Inform family and friends about limited connectivity in advance.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water
points: Khasi cuisine: Jadoh (rice with meat), Dohneiiong (pork with black sesame), Tungrymbai (fermented soybean), Pumaloi (steamed rice powder).
North Indian, Chinese, and Continental food widely available in Shillong and Cherrapunjee.
Stick to bottled or filtered water.
Try local tea and traditional meals at family-run eateries.
Carry dry fruits, chocolates, and energy bars for trekking days.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Khasis, Jaintias, and Garos are the major communities – each with unique matrilineal traditions.
Respect local customs and traditions.
Dress modestly, especially when visiting sacred groves and villages.
Ask permission before photographing locals and their property.
Mawphalang is Asia's cleanest village – do not litter, maintain hygiene.
Sacred groves are protected – do not remove anything.

keyInfo.title: Permits
points: Indian citizens do not require Inner Line Permit (ILP) for Meghalaya.
Foreign nationals require Protected Area Permit (PAP) – obtain in advance.
Carry valid government ID (Aadhar, Voter ID, Passport) for hotel check-ins.
Some restricted areas may require special permits – check with your tour operator.

points: Carry basic first aid kit – pain relievers, antiseptic, bandages, ORS.
Mosquito repellent is essential, especially in evenings.
Motion sickness pills recommended for winding roads.
Travel insurance is strongly recommended.
Be cautious while swimming in waterfalls – rocks can be slippery.
Stay hydrated, especially during trekking.

Spot Indian one-horned rhinoceros (2/3rd of world population)
Explore historic Sivasagar - Ahom dynasty capital
Visit Shiva Dole, Rang Ghar & Talatal Ghar
