itinerary.title: Arrival in Guwahati – Umananda & Sunset Cruise
itinerary.description: On arrival at Guwahati airport, our representative will meet you, welcome you to Assam and start our Assam tour. Meet and greet on arrival. Check in to the hotel. After freshen up, visit Umananda & Gandhi Mandap. Evening enjoy Sunset Cruise at Mighty River Brahmaputra (on a direct payment basis). Dinner and overnight stay at Guwahati.

itinerary.title: Guwahati to Sivasagar – Maa Kamakhya Temple
itinerary.description: Today after breakfast check out from the hotel and visit Maa Kamakhya Temple. Later drive to Sivasagar. Reach Sivasagar, and check in to the hotel. Dinner and night stay at Sivasagar.

itinerary.title: Sivasagar Sightseeing – Ahom Dynasty Heritage
itinerary.description: Today after breakfast, enjoy a full day of sightseeing at the historic town Sivasagar covering Shiva Dole & Shivasagar Tank, Rang Ghar, Talatal Ghar, Joy Dole & Joy Sagar Tank, Karang Ghar & Charaidew. Dinner and night stay at Sivasagar.

itinerary.title: Sivasagar to Kaziranga – Jeep Safari
highlights: Jeep safari at western range (own expense)
itinerary.description: Early morning after your breakfast, we will drive you to Kaziranga National Park (337 KM/ 06 HRS), which is popular for Indian one-horned Rhinoceros as well as a home to tigers, elephants, water buffaloes and many bird species. On arrival, you will check into the Hotel. Later, go for a jeep safari at the western range of the park (expenses on your own). After the safari, return to hotel. Overnight stay in the hotel at Kaziranga.

itinerary.title: Kaziranga – Elephant Safari & Jeep Safari
highlights: Spot swamp deer, hog deer, wild water buffalo
itinerary.description: Early morning we will take you to enjoy an elephant ride and exploration of the park. Encounter other animals apart from rhinos such as swamp deer, hog deer, elephants, wild water buffalos and if you are lucky, you can spot the tiger (expenses on your own). Return to the resort for breakfast, day free for relaxation. Later, you will venture into the central range of the park for a Jeep safari (expenses on your own). Later depart for Guwahati. Drop at Guwahati Airport / Railway Station for onward journey.

itinerary.title: Departure from Guwahati
itinerary.description: On the last day, enjoy your breakfast at the hotel. After that, pack your bags and check out from the hotel. Our representative will take you to Guwahati Airport or Railway Station for your onward journey, ending your wonderful Assam wildlife expedition with unforgettable memories of the one-horned rhinoceros and Assam's rich heritage.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Subtropical climate with hot summers and cool winters.
Summer (March-June): Light cotton clothes, sunscreen, hat.
Monsoon (July-September): Heavy rainfall, carry umbrella/raincoat.
Winter (October-February): Light woolens, jackets for evenings.
Comfortable walking shoes for safaris and sightseeing.
Earthy colored clothes recommended for safaris (avoid bright colors).

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: November to April – Ideal weather, best for wildlife viewing.
November to February – Pleasant temperatures, best for sightseeing.
March to May – Hot but good for bird watching.
Kaziranga National Park remains closed from May to October due to monsoon.
Peak season: December to January (book in advance).

keyInfo.title: Kaziranga Safari Information
points: Park divided into 4 zones: Central, Western, Eastern, and Burapahar.
Jeep safaris available in all zones (morning & afternoon slots).
Elephant safaris available in Central and Western zones (early morning).
Safari bookings subject to availability and forest department rules.
Safari timings: Morning (5:30-7:30 AM) & Afternoon (2:30-4:30 PM) approx.
Carry binoculars for better wildlife viewing.
Cameras with zoom lenses recommended for photography.

keyInfo.title: Wildlife at Kaziranga
points: Home to 2200+ Indian one-horned rhinoceros (2/3rd of world population).
Significant tiger population (Kaziranga Tiger Reserve).
Wild water buffalo, swamp deer, hog deer, elephants.
Over 480 bird species including migratory birds.
Ganges river dolphin in Brahmaputra River.
Spot rare species like Hispid hare and Bengal florican.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Assam is culturally rich with diverse communities.
Dress modestly when visiting temples (Kamakhya, Shiva Dole).
Remove shoes before entering temple premises.
Respect local customs and traditions.
Assamese people are warm and hospitable - greet with 'Namaskar'.

keyInfo.title: Food & Cuisine
points: Must-try Assamese thali with rice, dal, fish curry, and vegetables.
Famous dishes: Masor Tenga (sour fish curry), Duck meat curry.
Traditional snacks: Pitha (rice cakes), Jolpan (breakfast items).
Assam is famous for tea - don't miss authentic Assam tea.
Stick to bottled water for drinking.
Eat at trusted local restaurants or hotel restaurants.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity

Most hotels offer Wi-Fi (may be slow in remote areas).

itinerary.title: Arrival at NJP / Bagdogra – Transfer to Gangtok

itinerary.description: Pick up from NJP railway station / Bagdogra Airport to Gangtok. Drive through the Himalayan range as you reach Gangtok. Check-in to hotel surrounded by lush green mountains. Enjoy the evening exploring Gangtok city or its serene nature. Followed by dinner and drinks with a bonfire under the Gangtok skies.

itinerary.title: Gangtok Sightseeing – Monasteries & Waterfalls
itinerary.description: Start the day with a sumptuous breakfast, and head out for local sightseeing to famous Buddhist Monasteries: Rumtek Monastery, Ranka Monastery, Gunjang Monastery. Later visit Banjhakri Waterfall and Do Drul Chorten Stupa. Evening at leisure. Dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Gangtok to Lachen – Gateway to North Sikkim
itinerary.description: Head to Lachen (North Sikkim) after breakfast. Reach Lachen and check in to the hotel. Lunch at the Hotel with local delicacies. Reaching new Heights @ Gurudongmar Lake (The highest lake in the world) scheduled for next morning. Dinner and overnight stay at hotel.

itinerary.title: Gurudongmar Lake Excursion & Transfer to Lachung
highlights: Gurudongmar Lake - one of world's highest lakes
itinerary.description: Enjoy breakfast for a long day of exploring the North. Early morning excursion to Gurudongmar Lake (subject to permit availability). Later, head to Lachung, visiting Khanda waterfall, Bhim Nala fall, Bewma Falls, and more. Highway cuisine awaits for your lunch. Leisurely Dinner and overnight stay at hotel.

itinerary.title: Lachung to Gangtok – Return to Capital
itinerary.description: Have breakfast, and checkout from the hotel. Reach Gangtok. Enjoy the nightlife of the casino. Try your luck with a wide range of games to play. Dinner and overnight stay at Gangtok.

itinerary.title: Departure from Gangtok
itinerary.description: Breakfast, pack your bags with memories for a long journey back home. Transport to airport/railway station for your onward journey, ending your wonderful Sikkim Himalayan escape.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Gangtok has pleasant summers and cold winters.
Summer (March-June): Light woolens, cotton clothes.
Monsoon (July-September): Heavy rainfall, carry umbrella/raincoat.
Winter (October-February): Heavy woolens, jackets, gloves, caps.
North Sikkim (Lachen/Lachung) is extremely cold - carry thermal wear.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: March to June – Pleasant weather, blooming flowers, best for sightseeing.

destinations.description: Experience the royal heritage of Rajasthan with our Jaipur and Udaipur Tour Package. Journey through the Pink City's majestic forts and the White City's serene lakes, blending vibrant culture, architectural marvels, and timeless romance. Perfect for families, couples, and history lovers seeking an unforgettable Rajasthani experience.

packages.title: Jaipur and Udaipur Tour Package: Royal Rajasthan

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Explore UNESCO World Heritage Site – Amber Fort with underground tunnels
Visit Jaigarh Fort (Fort of Victory) & Nahargarh Fort overlooking Jaipur
Photograph the iconic Hawa Mahal's 900 tiny windows
Shop for Rajasthani handicrafts at vibrant Bapu Bazar
Witness sunset at Jal Mahal, the floating palace in Man Sagar Lake
Experience Udaipur's romantic Lake Pichola & Fateh Sagar Lake
Visit Sajjan Garh Palace (Monsoon Palace) with panoramic city views
Stroll through Saheliyon ki Bari – Garden of the Maidens
Panoramic views of Udaipur from Karni Mata Temple
inclusions: Pickup and Drop off (Airport/Railway station)
Accommodation for 4 nights on twin-sharing basis: 2 nights in Jaipur, 2 nights in Udaipur
Meals: 4 Buffet breakfasts & 4 Dinners
Transfers and sightseeing in private air-conditioned car
Vehicle provided as per the itinerary (not at disposal)
All current taxes: hotel taxes and transportation taxes
Driver allowance, fuel, toll, and parking charges
exclusions: Entrance fees at monuments, forts, palaces, and temples
Meals not mentioned in inclusions (lunches, additional meals)
Expenses of personal nature: tips, laundry, phone calls, etc
Any increase in government taxes or state taxes
Anything not specifically mentioned under Inclusions

itinerary.title: Arrival in Jaipur – Amber Fort & Majestic Forts
highlights: Amber Fort – UNESCO World Heritage Site
itinerary.description: Your Rajasthan journey begins as you arrive at Jaipur Airport or Railway station. Our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel and relax for a while. Later, get ready to explore the Pink City. First, discover the stunning Amber Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site perched high on a hill. Don't miss exploring the underground tunnels that connect Amer to Jaigarh Fort. Continue to Jaigarh Fort, also known as the Fort of Victory, and Nahargarh Fort, perched on the edge of the Aravalli Hills. Conclude with a photo stop at Jal Mahal, the beautiful palace floating in the middle of Man Sagar Lake. Return to your hotel for a delicious dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jaipur City Tour – Palaces, Bazaars & Museum
highlights: City Palace – Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh's palace
Hawa Mahal – Palace of Winds (900 tiny windows)
itinerary.description: After a mouthwatering breakfast, embark on your Jaipur city tour. Visit the magnificent City Palace, built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh, still home to the royal family. Next, head to the iconic Hawa Mahal, the Palace of Winds, with its 900 tiny windows adorned with intricate latticework. Continue to bustling Bapu Bazar, perfect for buying beautiful Rajasthani handicrafts, textiles, jewelry, and souvenirs. Conclude your day at the Albert Hall Museum, a grand architectural marvel spread across 19 acres. Return to your accommodation for a delicious dinner and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jaipur to Udaipur – Monsoon Palace & Lakes
highlights: Shilpgram – Rural art and craft complex
itinerary.description: Wake up early, enjoy your satisfying breakfast, and transfer to the beautiful city of Udaipur. The 9-10 hour scenic drive offers stunning views of Rajasthan's countryside. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and freshen up. Begin exploring Udaipur with a visit to Sajjan Garh Palace, also known as the Monsoon Palace, offering breathtaking panoramic views of Udaipur city and its surrounding lakes. Continue to the 1000-year-old Eklingji Temple complex, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Visit Shilpgram, a rural art and craft complex showcasing traditional Rajasthani culture. Head to Fateh Sagar Lake, a beautiful artificial lake built in the 1680s – sit quietly and enjoy the serenity. Explore Bagore ki Haweli, an 18th-century haveli overlooking Lake Pichola. Conclude at Jagdish Temple, an Indo-Aryan temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Return to your hotel for a satisfying meal and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Udaipur Exploration – City Palace, Gardens & Temples
highlights: Gulab Bagh – Largest garden in Udaipur
Saheliyon ki Bari – Garden of the Maidens
Karni Mata Temple – Panoramic city views
itinerary.description: After breakfast, discover more of Udaipur's treasures. First, visit the magnificent City Palace, a white palace complex that towers over Lake Pichola, offering rich heritage and stunning architecture. Next, head to Gulab Bagh, one of the largest gardens in Udaipur, perfect for a leisurely stroll. Spend quality time at the peaceful Lake Pichola, absorbing its romantic ambiance. Continue to Saheliyon ki Bari, or Garden of the Maidens, a stunning garden built for royal women of the Mewar dynasty. Capture beautiful photos with fountains and lush green lawns in the background. Finally, visit Karni Mata Temple, perched atop Machla Magra Hills, offering panoramic views of Udaipur city and Lake Pichola. Conclude your last day in Udaipur and return to your accommodation for a delicious dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Departure – Farewell to Rajasthan
itinerary.description: On the final day of your Jaipur to Udaipur trip, wake up early to the royal charm of Rajasthan. Enjoy your mouthwatering breakfast, then pack your bags with wonderful memories. Check out from your hotel and proceed either to Jaipur or Jodhpur Airport/Railway station for your onward journey. With a smile on your face and heart filled with memories of Rajasthan's royal grandeur, serene lakes, and vibrant culture, board your flight or train back home.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Udaipur – Palaces, Lakes & Temples
itinerary.description: Your Udaipur Mount Abu itinerary will begin when you arrive at Udaipur, the White City. As you reach this beautiful city, our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel, freshen up, and then start uncovering the pieces of Udaipur. You will first set out to Sajjan Garh Palace, also known as the Monsoon Palace, from where you can enjoy the breathtaking view of Udaipur city and surrounding lakes. Then you will go to the Eklingji Temple, a 1000-year-old temple complex dedicated to the god Shiva. This visit will be followed by a visit to Shilpgram, a rural art and craft complex. Keep your enthusiasm up as you will head to the Fateh Sagar Lake, a beautiful artificial lake built in the 1680s, sit here quietly and enjoy the serenity that you will feel around this lake. After the Fateh Sagar lake, you will head to the Bagore ki Haweli, a pristine Haveli of the 18th century surrounded by Lake Pichola. And lastly, uncover the Jagdish temple, an Indo Aryan temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Wrap up your Udaipur sightseeing, and head back to your stay location for a satisfying meal and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Udaipur – City Palace, Gardens & Hilltop Temple
itinerary.description: On the second day, you will get to know the remaining tale that Udaipur has. So wake up, have your satisfying breakfast, and get ready to explore more of Udaipur. You will first visit the City Palace, a white palace complex that towers over Lake Pichola. After getting the heritage essence of Rajasthan from the City Palace, you will head to the Gulab Bagh, one of the largest gardens in Udaipur. After that, you can go to Lake Pichola to enjoy your quality time at this peaceful lake. This will be followed by a visit to Saheliyon ki Bari or Garden of the Maidens, a stunning garden that was especially built for the royal women of the Mewar dynasty. Here you can take pictures with a beautiful fountain and lush green lawns in the background. Then you will visit Karni Mata temple, a Hindu temple located on top of the Machla Magra Hills, from where you can also enjoy the panoramic view of Udaipur City and Lake Pichola. Conclude your Udaipur sightseeing and come back to your accommodation. Here you will enjoy a delicious dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Udaipur to Mount Abu – Dilwara Temples & Nakki Lake
highlights: Scenic drive to Mount Abu (2-3 hours)
itinerary.description: On the third day, be excited about the Mount Abu Trip Plan. Wake up early, have your hearty breakfast, and then head to Mount Abu. It will only take two to three hours to reach here. Once you arrive, check into your hotel and get ready to explore Mount Abu. Here you will visit the Dilwara Jain temple, which has a five-temple complex, each dedicated to a different Jain Tirthankar. After your religious visit, you will go to the Nakki Lake, recognized as the first ever man-made lake in India. Here, spend some serene time. Then conclude your day at Mount Abu and head back to your accommodation, where a hearty dinner will be served. After enjoying your meal, go to a peaceful sleep.

itinerary.title: Departure from Mount Abu
itinerary.description: On the last day of your Mount Abu Udaipur trip, rise early to this beautiful state, have your mouthwatering breakfast, and then pack your bags. Check out of your hotel and head either to Udaipur for your onward journey. As you reach the airport or railway station, this will mark the end of your domestic package. With a smile on your face and heart filled with the memories of your Rajasthan tour, board your vehicle to fly back to your home.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Jaipur – Amber Fort & Hill Forts
itinerary.description: Your tour to Rajasthan will begin when you arrive at Jaipur. From there, our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel and relax for a while. Later, get ready to explore the Pink City. You will first discover the stunning Amber Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site located high on a hill. This eye-catching fort also has underground tunnels that connect Amer to Jaigarh Fort, so don't miss exploring these underground tunnels. Then you will visit some of the fascinating forts of Jaipur, Jaigarh Fort, also known as the fort of victory, and Nahargarh Fort, perched on the edge of the Aravalli Hills. This will be followed by the Jal Mahal, a beautiful palace situated in the middle of the Man Sagar Lake. After exploring Jaipur, you will return back to your hotel for a delicious dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jaipur – City Palace, Hawa Mahal & Local Bazaar
itinerary.description: On the second day, you will explore more of Jaipur city. So rise and shine early, have your mouthwatering breakfast, and then you will visit City Palace, a beautiful palace built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh. Then you will head to the Hawa Mahal, another stunning palace built of red and pink sandstone. It has almost 900 tiny windows adorned with latticework. Next in the line will be Bapu Bazar, from where you can buy beautiful Rajasthani handicraft material. This will be followed by the Albert Hall Museum, a grand architectural marvel spreading across 19 acres. After the Jaipur city tour, you will come back to your accommodation, where a delicious dinner will be served. After enjoying your meal, you can go to a peaceful sleep.

itinerary.description: On the third day, you will transfer to Ranthambore, so wake up early, have your delicious breakfast, and then set off to Ranthambore. In three to four hours, you will reach there. Check into your hotel and freshen up. Later, you will go to the Ranthambore National Park, one of the biggest and renowned national parks in northern India, which is mainly famous for the Royal Bengal Tiger. Here, enjoy the Safari and get to know about the different types of forests and wildlife. After that, you will visit the Trinetra Ganesh temple, the only temple in the world that has the entire family of Lord Ganesha. Conclude your Ranthambore trip and come back to your hotel for a delicious dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Ranthambore to Udaipur – Scenic Drive

It will take almost nine to ten hours to reach Udaipur. As you arrive, check into your hotel and freshen up. The rest of the day will be at leisure; you can explore this white city the way you want to. Conclude your leisure day and come back to your accommodation for a healthy meal and an overnight stay.

packages.title: Jaipur and Udaipur Travel Package: A 6-Day Journey Through Rajasthan's Regal Charm

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Explore Jaipur's Amber Fort, City Palace & Hawa Mahal - the Pink City
Visit Jaigarh Fort & Nahargarh Fort with stunning Aravalli views
Marvel at Jal Mahal - the palace floating in Man Sagar Lake
Shop for Rajasthani handicrafts at Bapu Bazar
Discover Udaipur's Sajjan Garh Palace (Monsoon Palace)
Enjoy serene moments at Fateh Sagar Lake & Lake Pichola
Explore Saheliyon ki Bari - Garden of the Maidens
Panoramic views from Karni Mata Temple
Perfect blend of heritage, culture & romantic charm
inclusions: Pickup and Drop off
Accommodation on twin-sharing basis for 5 nights
Meals: Buffet breakfast at all places
Transfers from one place to another
Sightseeing in private cars
Vehicle provided based on the itinerary
All current taxes - hotel taxes and transportation taxes
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
Travel assistance by Travel Junky Experts
exclusions: Expenses of personal nature - tips, laundry, bar bills, table bills, camera fees

itinerary.title: Arrival in Jaipur – Amber Fort & Hill Forts
itinerary.description: Your Jaipur and Udaipur tour package will begin when you arrive at Jaipur. From there, our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel and relax for a while. Later, get ready to explore the Pink City. You will first discover the stunning Amber Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site located high on a hill. This eye-catching fort also has underground tunnels that connect Amer to Jaigarh Fort, so don't miss exploring these underground tunnels. Then you will visit some of the fascinating forts of Jaipur, Jaigarh Fort, also known as the fort of victory, and Nahargarh Fort, perched on the edge of the Aravalli Hills. This will be followed by the Jal Mahal, a beautiful palace situated in the middle of the Man Sagar Lake. After exploring Jaipur, you will return back to your hotel for a delicious dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jaipur – City Palace, Hawa Mahal & Local Bazaar
itinerary.description: On the second day, you will explore more of Jaipur city. So rise and shine early, have your mouthwatering breakfast, and then you will visit City Palace, a beautiful palace built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh. Then you will head to the Hawa Mahal, another stunning palace built of red and pink sandstone. It has almost 900 tiny windows adorned with latticework. Next in the line will be Bapu Bazar, from where you can buy beautiful Rajasthani handicraft material. This will be followed by the Albert Hall Museum, a grand architectural marvel spreading across 19 acres. After exploring Jaipur and its marvels, you will come back to your accommodation, where a delicious dinner will be served. After enjoying your meal, you can go to a peaceful sleep.

itinerary.title: Jaipur to Udaipur – Scenic Drive & Leisure Evening
itinerary.description: On the third day, you will transfer to the new destination of Rajasthan, Udaipur. So wake up early, have your satisfying breakfast, and then get ready to enjoy the scenic views that will come on your route from Jaipur to Udaipur. It will take almost nine to ten hours to reach Udaipur. As you arrive, check into your hotel and freshen up. The rest of the day will be at leisure; you can explore this white city the way you want to. Conclude your leisure day and come back to your accommodation for a healthy meal and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Udaipur – Palaces, Lakes & Temples
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, you will uncover the pieces of Udaipur. Rise early, have your hearty breakfast, and then set out to Sajjan Garh Palace, also known as the Monsoon Palace, from where you can enjoy the breathtaking view of Udaipur city and surrounding lakes. Then you will go to the Eklingji Temple, a 1000-year-old temple complex dedicated to the god Shiva. This visit will be followed by a visit to Shilpgram, a rural art and craft complex. Keep your enthusiasm up as you will head to the Fateh Sagar Lake, a beautiful artificial lake built in the 1680s, sit here quietly and enjoy the serenity that you will feel around this lake. After the Fateh Sagar lake, you will head to the Bagore ki Haweli, a pristine Haveli of the 18th century surrounded by Lake Pichola. And lastly, uncover the Jagdish temple, an Indo Aryan temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Wrap up your Udaipur sightseeing, and head back to your stay location for a satisfying meal and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Udaipur – City Palace, Gardens & Hilltop Temple
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, you will get to know the remaining tale that Udaipur has. So wake up, have your satisfying breakfast, and get ready to explore more of Udaipur. You will first visit the City Palace, a white palace complex that towers over Lake Pichola. After getting the heritage essence of Rajasthan from the City Palace, you will head to the Gulab Bagh, one of the largest gardens in Udaipur. After that, you can go to Lake Pichola to enjoy your quality time at this peaceful lake. This will be followed by a visit to Saheliyon ki Bari or Garden of the Maidens, a stunning garden that was especially built for the royal women of the Mewar dynasty. Here you can take pictures with a beautiful fountain and lush green lawns in the background. Then you will visit Karni Mata temple, a Hindu temple located on top of the Machla Magra Hills, from where you can also enjoy the panoramic view of Udaipur City and Lake Pichola. Conclude your last day at Udaipur and come back to your accommodation. Here you will enjoy a delicious dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Departure from Udaipur
itinerary.description: On the last day of your Rajasthan Tour Plan, rise early to this beautiful state, have your mouthwatering breakfast, and then pack your bags. Check out of your hotel and head to Udaipur Airport or Railway Station. As you reach your departure point, this will mark the end of your domestic package. With a smile on your face and heart filled with the memories of your Rajasthan tour, board your vehicle to fly back to your home.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Rajasthan has extreme climate - hot summers and cold winters.
Summer (March-June): Light cotton clothes, sunscreen, hat, sunglasses.
Monsoon (July-September): Light rain, carry umbrella.
Winter (October-February): Light woolens for evenings and mornings.
Comfortable walking shoes for fort and palace explorations.
Layered clothing recommended for changing temperatures.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: October to March – Pleasant weather, ideal for sightseeing.
November to February – Cool temperatures, best for outdoor exploration.
December to January – Peak tourist season, book in advance.
July to September – Monsoon, less crowd, lush greenery.
April to June – Very hot (40-45°C), not recommended for sightseeing.

keyInfo.title: Jaipur - The Pink City
points: Capital of Rajasthan, founded in 1727 by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II.
Known as 'Pink City' because of its distinct terracotta-pink buildings.
First planned city of India with grid-like architectural pattern.
Famous for its Rajput-era palaces, forts, and vibrant bazaars.
UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2019.
Known for gemstone cutting and jewelry making.

keyInfo.title: Udaipur - The City of Lakes
points: Founded in 1559 by Maharana Udai Singh II.
Known as the 'Venice of the East' and 'City of Lakes'.
Famous for its Rajput-era palaces and artificial lakes.
Lake Pichola is the most famous lake, surrounded by palaces.
City Palace is the largest palace complex in Rajasthan.
Popular destination for destination weddings and honeymoons.

destinations.description: Embark on a sacred Himalayan pilgrimage with our Chardham Yatra Tour Package, taking you through the four revered shrines of Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. This spiritually enriching journey through the Garhwal Himalayas offers breathtaking landscapes, serene riverbanks, ancient temples, and divine blessings. Ideal for pilgrims and peace seekers alike, this yatra promises a comfortable, safe, and transformative experience in God's own country.

packages.title: Chardham Yatra Tour Package: Sacred Himalayan Pilgrimage

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Attend the divine Ganga Aarti at Haridwar
Trek to Yamunotri Temple via Janki Chatti (5-6 km)
Holy dip in Yamunotri's hot spring & Divya Shila prayer
Visit Gangotri Temple – highest temple dedicated to Goddess Ganga
Scenic drive through Doon Valley & Kempty Falls
14 km Kedarnath trek with breathtaking Himalayan views
Sacred dip at Gaurikund hot water spring
Darshan at Badrinath Temple & evening Aarti
Explore Gangnani, Dharali & Harsil en route
Visit Shankaracharya Samadhi, Pitra Kund & Udar Kund
inclusions: Accommodation for 10 nights as per itinerary
10 Breakfasts & 10 Dinners
All transfers and sightseeing by private air-conditioned cab as per itinerary
All inter-state taxes, toll taxes, driver allowance & parking

itinerary.title: Arrival in Haridwar – Ganga Aarti & Spiritual Evening
itinerary.description: Your Uttarakhand Chardham Yatra begins as you arrive at Haridwar. Our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel and freshen up. Enjoy your delicious breakfast. Step outside and explore the spiritual capital of India – visit ancient temples, peaceful ashrams, or sit near the serene river ghats. In the evening, attend the world-famous Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri, witnessing the divine spectacle of lamps, chants, and devotion. Feel the serenity and spiritual energy that Haridwar is renowned for. Return to your hotel for a mouthwatering dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Haridwar to Barkot – Doon Valley & Kempty Falls
itinerary.description: Wake up early, check out from Haridwar, and proceed to Barkot. En route, enjoy breathtaking scenic views of the Doon Valley, nestled between the Lesser Himalaya and the Shivalik Range. Stop at the beautiful Kempty Falls near Mussoorie – capture photos and enjoy the cascading water. Continue your journey through winding mountain roads adorned with pine forests and river streams. Reach Barkot by evening, check into your accommodation, and acclimatize yourself for the Yamunotri trek ahead. Enjoy a hearty dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Yamunotri Trek – Divya Shila & Hot Spring Dip
itinerary.description: After a nutritious breakfast, proceed to Janki Chatti, the starting point of the Yamunotri trek. Begin your 5-6 km trek through stunning Himalayan landscapes, with breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks and the sacred Yamuna River flowing alongside. The 4-5 hour trek leads you to the beautiful Yamunotri Temple, dedicated to Goddess Yamuna. Offer prayers at Divya Shila, a sacred stone near the temple entrance, and take a holy dip in the Tapt Kund hot spring, believed to have healing properties. You can pre-book the evening aarti ceremony. After your spiritual visit, trek down to Janki Chatti and drive back to Barkot. Enjoy a delicious dinner and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Barkot to Uttarkashi – Himalayan Journey
itinerary.description: Rise early, enjoy your breakfast, and check out from Barkot as you proceed to Uttarkashi. This 4-5 hour journey offers spectacular views of the Garhwal Himalayas, lush valleys, and pristine rivers. The drive itself is a spiritual experience, with every turn revealing nature's grandeur. Reach Uttarkashi by afternoon, check into your accommodation, and rest for a while. Uttarkashi, meaning 'Kashi of the north', is home to the revered Kashi Vishwanath Temple. Enjoy a mouthwatering dinner and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi to Gangotri – Goddess Ganga's Abode
itinerary.description: Wake up early and enjoy your breakfast as you embark on the journey to Gangotri, one of the four sacred Char Dham shrines. The 3-4 hour drive offers serene views of the Bhagirathi River, towering mountains, and verdant valleys. Reach Gangotri town and visit the Gangotri Temple, the highest temple dedicated to Goddess Ganga, built by the Gorkha general Amar Singh Thapa. Offer prayers and take a holy dip at the Gangotri ghat, believed to absolve sins. En route back to Uttarkashi, explore additional scenic destinations like Gangnani (famous for hot springs), Dharali, and Harsil – each offering unique Himalayan beauty. Based on timing, you may stay at Gangnani or return to Uttarkashi. Rejuvenate with a mouthwatering dinner and peaceful sleep.

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi to Guptkashi – Garhwal Himalayan Drive
itinerary.description: Start your day with a satisfying breakfast and continue your Chardham Yatra with a beautiful drive from Uttarkashi/Gangnani to Guptkashi. This 8-10 hour journey through the Garhwal Himalayas is nothing short of spectacular – winding roads, pine forests, gushing rivers, and panoramic mountain views. Enjoy every moment of this ride – listen to devotional music, feel the cool Himalayan breeze, or simply meditate on the divine landscape. Reach Sitapur/Guptkashi by evening, complete check-in formalities, and relax. Enjoy your delicious dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kedarnath Trek – Lord Shiva's Divine Abode
highlights: Holy dip at Gaurikund hot spring
itinerary.description: After an energizing breakfast, drive to Gaurikund, a 15-20 minute journey. Take a fresh, holy dip at the Gaurikund hot water spring, believed to be where Goddess Parvati meditated to win Lord Shiva. Begin your 14 km sacred trek to Kedarnath – this 6-8 hour journey is the highlight of your yatra. Walk alongside fellow devotees, chanting hymns and absorbing the spiritual energy of the Himalayas. Upon reaching Kedarnath, offer prayers at the ancient Kedarnath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and one of the 12 Jyotirlingas. Visit the Shankaracharya Samadhi, the resting place of Adi Shankaracharya. Don't miss darshan at Pitra Kund and Udar Kund. Seek blessings from meditating sadhus near Rama Cave. After this divine experience, return to your stay location, enjoy a mouthwatering dinner, and rest well.

itinerary.title: Kedarnath Descent – Return to Guptkashi
itinerary.description: Wake up early to the divine vibrations of Kedarnath. Enjoy your satisfying breakfast and begin your descent back to Gaurikund. The trek down offers a different perspective of the majestic Himalayas. Upon reaching Gaurikund, our driver will take you back to Sitapur/Guptkashi. Spend the day at your own pace – rest, reflect on your Kedarnath experience, or explore the local surroundings. Enjoy a mouthwatering dinner and rest well.

itinerary.title: Guptkashi to Badrinath – Lord Vishnu's Abode
itinerary.description: Rise early, enjoy a fulfilling breakfast, and check out from Guptkashi. Proceed on your 10-12 hour journey to Badrinath, the final Dham of your Chardham Yatra. The drive through the Alaknanda River valley offers spectacular mountain scenery. By evening, reach the sacred Badrinath Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and part of the 108 Divya Desams. Offer prayers and attend the divine evening Aarti. Feel the spiritual energy of this ancient pilgrimage site, surrounded by the Nar and Narayan mountain ranges. Return to your accommodation, enjoy a delicious dinner, and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Badrinath to Rishikesh – Return to the Foothills
itinerary.description: On your second-to-last day, wake up early and enjoy your breakfast. Head back from Badrinath to Rishikesh/Haridwar. This 10-12 hour journey takes you through the ever-changing landscapes of Uttarakhand – from high-altitude Himalayan terrain to lush foothills. Look outside the window, admire the beauty, listen to devotional music, or meditate on your yatra experience. Reach Rishikesh/Haridwar by evening, check into your hotel, and enjoy your mouthwatering dinner. Reflect on your divine journey as you rest for the night.

itinerary.title: Departure – Farewell to the Himalayas
itinerary.description: On the final day of your Chardham Yatra, rise and shine early. Enjoy your fulfilling breakfast and check out from your hotel, carrying beautiful memories, divine blessings, and a heart full of spiritual fulfillment. Our representative will transfer you to the airport or railway station for your onward journey back home. May the blessings of Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath remain with you always.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: May to June – Peak season, pleasant weather, all routes open.
September to October – Post-monsoon, clear skies, fewer crowds.
November to April – Winter season, Kedarnath & Badrinath closed due to heavy snow.
July to August – Monsoon season, landslides possible, trekking challenging.
Kedarnath Temple opens in April/May and closes in October/November.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Summer (May-June): 15°C to 25°C – Light woolens, comfortable cottons.
Winter (Nov-Apr): -5°C to 10°C – Heavy woolens, thermal inners, down jacket, gloves, monkey cap.
Monsoon (Jul-Sep): 10°C to 20°C – Raincoat, umbrella, waterproof shoes.
Sturdy trekking shoes with good grip are essential for Yamunotri & Kedarnath treks.
Carry multiple layers – temperature drops significantly at higher altitudes.

keyInfo.title: Trekking Information
points: Yamunotri Trek: 5-6 km one way, 4-5 hours, moderate difficulty.
Kedarnath Trek: 14 km one way, 6-8 hours, moderate to difficult.
Ponies, palanquins, and dolly services available at additional cost.
Start treks early morning to avoid afternoon weather changes.
Carry water, energy bars, dry fruits, and basic medications.
Hire licensed guides for better experience and safety.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Haridwar, Rishikesh, Dehradun have excellent 4G coverage.
Barkot, Uttarkashi, Guptkashi have decent mobile network (BSNL/Airtel).
Kedarnath and Yamunotri have very limited/no network.
Badrinath has BSNL connectivity.
Inform family and friends about limited connectivity in advance.
Offline maps are highly recommended.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water
points: Uttarakhand cuisine is simple and sattvic, especially near temples.
Must-try: Aloo ke Gutke, Phaanu, Kafuli, Chainsoo, Bal Mithai, Singhauri.
Stick to bottled or filtered water throughout the yatra.
Vegetarian-only food in pilgrimage areas – no alcohol/non-veg near temples.
Eat at recommended or hygienic restaurants and hotel dining areas.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Respect local traditions and temple customs.
Dress modestly – cover shoulders and knees, avoid revealing clothes.
Remove shoes before entering temple premises.
Photography is prohibited inside most temples.
Avoid public display of affection near religious sites.
Maintain silence and discipline during aarti ceremonies.

keyInfo.title: Health Precautions
points: Carry motion sickness tablets for winding mountain roads.
High-altitude acclimatization is essential – take it slow on trek days.
Basic medical kit: pain relievers, antiseptic, bandages, ORS, Diamox (after consulting doctor).
Carry personal medications for at least 10-12 days.
Oxygen levels drop at Kedarnath (11,755 ft) and Badrinath (10,279 ft).
Travel insurance is strongly recommended.

keyInfo.title: Local Laws
points: Consumption of alcohol and meat is strictly prohibited in Haridwar, Rishikesh, Badrinath, and Kedarnath.
Smoking is banned in public places.
Avoid plastic use near rivers and forest zones – carry reusable bottles.
Respect wildlife and forest regulations.
Follow temple entry timings and dress codes strictly.

keyInfo.title: Eco-Responsibility
points: Uttarakhand's fragile Himalayan ecosystems need your care.
Say no to plastic – carry reusable water bottles and bags.
Do not litter on treks, temple routes, or river ghats.
Keep Ganga and its tributaries clean – do not offer plastic-wrapped items.
Take only memories, leave only footprints.
Respect the 'Clean Yatra' mission of the Uttarakhand government.

packages.title: Mussoorie to Nainital: 7 Days Uttarakhand Tour Package

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Explore Mussoorie - Queen of the Hills with Mall Road & Kempty Falls
Visit Lal Tibba & Gun Hill for panoramic Himalayan views
Experience spirituality at Rishikesh with Ganga Aarti
Cross iconic Ram Jhula & Laxman Jhula suspension bridges
Thrilling jungle safari at Jim Corbett National Park
Spot tigers, elephants & deer in their natural habitat
Enjoy panoramic views from Tiffin Top & Snow View Point in Nainital
Visit Raj Bhawan - grand British-era Governor's House
Perfect blend of mountains, wildlife, spirituality & lakes
Ideal for families, couples & groups seeking complete Uttarakhand experience
inclusions: Transportation as per itinerary
Accommodation on sharing basis for 6 nights
6 Breakfasts & 6 Dinners at stay locations
Local sightseeing as per the itinerary
Driver allowances, toll taxes, parking fees
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
Travel assistance by Travel Junky Experts
exclusions: Expenses of personal nature - tips, telephone calls, laundry, medication
Any monument entry fees / Camera fees
Any adventure activity (river rafting, trekking, etc.)
Any climatic or unexpected condition expenses
Anything else not mentioned in inclusions

itinerary.title: Departure to Mussoorie – Arrival & Mall Road
itinerary.description: Your 7-day Uttarakhand Tour package will begin as you depart for Mussoorie in the morning. Enjoy the scenic journey till you reach your destination. In the evening, you will arrive at Mussoorie, the Queen of the Hills. Our driver will take you to your hotel and assist with the check-in formalities. After resting a bit in your accommodation, start exploring. You can visit Mall Road, famous for its local shops and cafes, with a beautiful view of Doon Valley. Later, come back to your stay location, have your tasty, cozy dinner, and then go for a peaceful sleep in the lap of the mountains.

itinerary.title: Mussoorie Sightseeing – Lal Tibba, Gun Hill & Kempty Falls
itinerary.description: The second day will start with the sightseeing of Mussoorie, so rise and shine early, have your fulfilling breakfast, and then head to Lal Tibba, the highest peak point in Uttarakhand. Uncover Gun Hill, the second-highest peak offering stunning views of snow-clad Himalayan ranges, namely Srikantha, Bandarpunch, Pithwara, and Gangotri. Then visit the popular waterfall, Kempty Falls, to play with water. End your Mussoorie sightseeing tour, and then our driver will take you back to your accommodation. Check into your hotel and rest for a while. Later, your mouthwatering dinner will be served, and after enjoying the dinner, go for a proper rest.

itinerary.title: Mussoorie to Rishikesh – Ram Jhula, Laxman Jhula & Ganga Aarti
itinerary.description: On the third day, rise and shine early, have your delicious breakfast, then set out to explore the Yoga Capital of India, Rishikesh. It will be a journey of two to three hours. Once you reach, start exploring the nearby attractions like the Ram Jhula and the Laxman Jhula, two iron suspension bridges. Then, in the evening, attend the spiritual Ganga Aarti. Wrap up your day by coming back to your accommodation. Your mouthwatering dinner will be served. After enjoying the meal, sleep well.

itinerary.title: Rishikesh to Jim Corbett – India's First National Park
itinerary.description: On day four, have your fulfilling breakfast, then check out of your hotel and head to the Jim Corbett National Park situated in the Nainital district. It will be a journey of three to four hours. Once you arrive, start exploring this first national park of India, known for its tiger richness. Later in the evening, you can spend your time at your own pace, then head to your stay location for dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jim Corbett – Jungle Safari & Transfer to Nainital
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, wake up early and set out for the thrilling Jungle Safari in the Jim Corbett National Park, where you can perfectly spot tigers, elephants, and deer in their natural habitat. Afterward, go to your hotel again, have your delicious breakfast, and enjoy your leisure time. In the late morning, you will depart for Nainital, which will take approximately three to four hours of journey. Once you reach, check into your hotel, and freshen up. You can head to the Mall Road to see the beauty of Nainital. Then come back to your accommodation, enjoy your meal, and then conclude your day with a perfect sleep.

itinerary.title: Nainital Sightseeing – Tiffin Top, Snow View Point & Raj Bhawan
highlights: Nanda Devi, Nanda Kot & Trishul views
itinerary.description: Your Sixth day will be spent sightseeing in the beautiful city of Nainital. Rise early, have your mouth-watering breakfast, and then head to Mall Road, the heart of Nainital. Then you will visit Tiffin Top, from where you can get a 360-degree view of the Nainital city. Continue your journey to the Snow View Point, which will give an exceptional view of the snow-covered Nanda Devi Peak, Nanda Kot Peak, and Trishul Peak. Then discover the Raj Bhawan or the Governor's house, a grand British-era building known for its architecture and lush gardens. By the evening, wrap up your Nainital Sightseeing tour and come back to the hotel for a satisfying dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Departure from Nainital
itinerary.description: On the seventh day, wake up, have your delicious breakfast, and then check out of your hotel and depart for Delhi. By the evening, you will reach Delhi, ending your beautiful 7-day Uttarakhand trip.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Uttarakhand offers diverse weather - chilly in hill stations, mild in plains.
Summer (March-June): Light woolens in mornings/evenings, cotton during day.
Monsoon (July-September): Carry raincoat/umbrella, expect landslides.
Winter (October-February): Heavy woolens, jackets, gloves, caps.
Pack layers for changing temperatures throughout the day.
Comfortable walking shoes for sightseeing and safaris.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: March to June – Pleasant weather, ideal for hill stations.
April to June – Best time for Jim Corbett Safari (animals gather near water).
September to November – Post-monsoon freshness, clear skies.
December to February – Snowfall in Mussoorie & Nainital, perfect for snow lovers.
July to August – Monsoon, lush greenery but risk of landslides.
Rishikesh is pleasant throughout the year except peak summer.

keyInfo.title: Mussoorie - Queen of Hills
points: Located at 2,000 meters altitude in the Garhwal Himalayas.
Established in 1823 by British Captain Frederick Young.
Famous for its scenic landscapes and colonial charm.
Lal Tibba is the highest point at 2,290 meters.
Kempty Falls is the most popular waterfall, great for photography.
Gun Hill offers panoramic views of the Himalayas.

keyInfo.title: Rishikesh - Yoga Capital
points: Situated on the banks of River Ganga at the foothills of Himalayas.
World-famous for yoga, meditation, and spirituality.
Ram Jhula & Laxman Jhula are iconic suspension bridges.
Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is a must-attend spiritual experience.
Gateway to Himalayan pilgrimage destinations (Char Dham).
Adventure hub for river rafting, bungee jumping, and camping.

keyInfo.title: Jim Corbett National Park
points: India's first national park, established in 1936.
Named after legendary hunter-turned-conservationist Jim Corbett.
Part of the larger Corbett Tiger Reserve.
Home to Bengal tigers, elephants, leopards, and 600+ bird species.
Divided into multiple safari zones (Dhikala, Bijrani, Jhirna, etc.).
Park closed during monsoon (July-September).

keyInfo.title: Nainital - City of Lakes
points: Located around Naini Lake at 1,938 meters altitude.
Named after Goddess Naina Devi.
Popular as 'Lake District of India'.
Tiffin Top offers 360-degree views of the town and Himalayas.
Snow View Point accessible by cable car for Himalayan vistas.
Raj Bhawan is a stunning example of British Gothic architecture.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Uttarakhand is spiritually significant with many temples.
Dress modestly when visiting religious sites.
Remove shoes before entering temples.
Alcohol and non-vegetarian food prohibited in Rishikesh and Haridwar.
Respect local customs and traditions.
Avoid public display of affection near religious spots.

keyInfo.title: Food & Cuisine
points: Uttarakhand cuisine is simple and sattvic, especially near temples.
Must-try dishes: Aloo Ke Gutke, Chainsoo, Kafuli, Phaanu.
Local snacks: Bal Mithai, Singodi, Ras (sweet dishes).
Rishikesh has excellent cafes serving global cuisine.
Stick to bottled water for drinking.
Expect vegetarian-only food in pilgrimage areas.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Towns like Rishikesh, Nainital, Dehradun, and Mussoorie have decent internet.
Jim Corbett has limited network in remote zones.
Most hotels offer Wi-Fi (may be slow in remote areas).
Offline maps are handy for navigation.
ATMs available in all towns.

Sunscreen, sunglasses, sunhat

packages.title: Kedarnath Temple Tour Guide

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Witness the divine Ganga Aarti at Haridwar
Trek 14 km through scenic Himalayas to Kedarnath Temple
Visit the revered Kedarnath Temple - one of 12 Jyotirlingas
Take holy dip at Gaurikund hot water spring
Explore sacred sites: Pitra Kund, Udar Kund & Rama Cave
Pass through holy towns of Guptkashi, Rudraprayag & Devprayag
Visit Ram Jhula & Laxman Jhula in Rishikesh
Experience spiritual energy at the Yoga Capital of India
Perfect blend of devotion, adventure & Himalayan beauty
inclusions: Pickup and drop-off from bus stand or railway station
Comfortable and hygienic vehicle (Sedan, SUV, or Traveller) for sightseeing on all days as per itinerary
Stay on double and triple sharing basis in hygienic and sanitized hotels
Breakfast as per the itinerary
Highly-Experienced driver cum guide
Sightseeing as per the itinerary
Assistance at all arrival and departure points
Travel assistance by Travel Junky Experts
exclusions: Any Meals / Drinks other than inclusions
Pony / Palanquin / Helicopter charges for Kedarnath trek
Anything not mentioned in the itinerary

itinerary.title: Arrival in Haridwar – Ganga Aarti & Spiritual Immersion
itinerary.description: Your Kedarnath Tour Plan will begin as you arrive at Haridwar. From there, our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel and freshen up, and step outside and explore Haridwar. You can visit the temples, and ashrams, or sit near the peaceful river ghats. In the evening, you will attend the famous Ganga Aarti and enjoy the serenity that this place creates during the aarti. Wrap up your day by returning to the hotel for a mouthwatering dinner and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Haridwar to Sonprayag – Gateway to Kedarnath
itinerary.description: On the second day, you will go to Sonprayag to start your Kedarnath trek. Wake up early, have your delicious breakfast, and then get ready for a long drive of eight to ten hours, taking you to Sonprayag. On the way, you will pass the most religious place, Guptkashi. By the evening, you will reach Sonprayag, the base point for the Kedarnath Trek. Check into your hotel, have healthy food, and then rest well to prepare for the next day's trek.

itinerary.title: Sonprayag to Kedarnath – The Divine Trek
highlights: Holy dip at Gaurikund hot spring
itinerary.description: On the third day, get excited as you will go on the amazing Kedarnath trek. Rise and shine early, and have your satisfying breakfast. After the meal, our driver will take you to Gaurikund, which is only a twenty to thirty-minute drive. As you reach Gaurikund, take a fresh dip at the Gaurikund hot water spring and begin your exciting trek to Kedarnath, which is around a 14 km trek. In this six-to-eight-hour period, take in the beautiful view and chant the hymns along with the other devotees. Once you reach, offer prayers to Lord Shiva, and visit the Shankaracharya Samadhi, the resting place of Adi Shankaracharya. Don't miss the darshan of Pitra Kund and Udar Kund. Then go to seek blessings from Lord Shiva and meditate with sadhus near Rama Cave. End your Kedarnath trek and come back to your stay location, where, after having your meal, you can rest.

itinerary.title: Kedarnath to Sonprayag – Return Trek
itinerary.description: After the amazing Kedarnath Trek, descend back to Gaurikund. While returning, again enjoy the trek by admiring the beauty of the surroundings or clicking the best Instagrammable photos. As you reach Gaurikund, our driver will take you to Sonprayag. Once you arrive at your accommodation, have your mouthwatering breakfast and then rest well.

itinerary.title: Sonprayag to Rishikesh – Yoga Capital of India
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, rise and shine early, have your delicious breakfast, then set out to explore the Yoga capital of India, Rishikesh. It will be a journey of eight to ten hours from where you will pass Guptkashi, Rudraprayag, and Devprayag. Once you reach, start exploring the nearby attractions like Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula, two iron suspension bridges. Then, in the evening, attend the spiritual Ganga Aarti. Wrap up your day by coming back to your accommodation. Your mouthwatering dinner will be served. After enjoying the meal, sleep well.

itinerary.title: Departure from Rishikesh
itinerary.description: On this day, wake up early and have your satisfying breakfast. Pack your stuff and check out of your hotel, carrying all the wonderful memories of your spiritual trip. As you reach the airport, carry all the positive aura that you have felt after the Kedarnath temple visit and a promise to enjoy more such trips with Travel Junky.

keyInfo.title: High Altitude & Trek Information
points: Kedarnath is at an altitude of 11,755 feet (3,583 meters).
The trek is 14 km one way from Gaurikund to Kedarnath.
Trek takes 6-8 hours depending on fitness level.
Ponies, palanquins, and helicopter services available (at own cost).
Acclimatization is crucial - take it slow and stay hydrated.
Carry warm clothes even in summer as temperatures drop.

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Visit
points: May to June – Pleasant weather, ideal for trekking.
September to October – Post-monsoon, clear skies.
Kedarnath Temple opens in April/May (Akshaya Tritiya).
Kedarnath Temple closes in October/November (Diwali).
Avoid monsoon (July-August) due to landslides and heavy rain.
Winter (November-April) temple remains closed due to snow.

keyInfo.title: Kedarnath Temple Significance
points: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva.
Part of the Char Dham pilgrimage circuit.
Believed to be built by the Pandavas and revived by Adi Shankaracharya.
Temple can only be accessed by trekking or helicopter.
Legend says Lord Shiva manifested as a bull here.
Adi Shankaracharya's Samadhi is located behind the temple.

keyInfo.title: Sacred Sites en Route
points: Gaurikund: Hot water spring where Goddess Parvati meditated.
Guptkashi: Ancient temple town on the way to Kedarnath.
Rudraprayag: Confluence of Alaknanda and Mandakini rivers.
Devprayag: Confluence of Alaknanda and Bhagirathi (forms Ganga).
Shankaracharya Samadhi: Final resting place of Adi Shankaracharya.
Rama Cave: Where Lord Rama is believed to have meditated.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Uttarakhand offers diverse weather - chilly in hill stations, mild in plains.
Summer (May-June): Light woolens in mornings/evenings, trekking clothes.
Monsoon (July-September): Heavy rain, risk of landslides.
Winter (October onwards): Heavy woolens, jackets, gloves, caps.
Pack layers for changing temperatures throughout the day.
Waterproof trekking shoes are essential.
Raincoat/poncho mandatory even in summer (weather unpredictable).

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Kedarnath is a highly sacred pilgrimage site.
Dress modestly - covered shoulders and knees.
Remove shoes before entering temple premises.
Alcohol and non-vegetarian food strictly prohibited.
Photography restricted inside temple sanctum.
Respect local customs and traditions.
Maintain silence and reverence in temple areas.

keyInfo.title: Health Precautions
points: Carry motion sickness tablets for winding mountain roads.
High-altitude symptoms: headache, nausea, dizziness - take it slow.
Basic medical kit with oxygen can be helpful.
Carry personal medications for the entire duration.
Stay hydrated - drink plenty of water.
Avoid heavy meals before trekking.
Consult doctor before planning if you have health conditions.

Rishikesh and Haridwar have excellent network.

packages.title: Kedarkantha Tour Package: 5-Day Trek Escape

price.per: Per Adult on twin sharing basis

highlights: Summit Kedarkantha Peak at 12,500 ft with 360° Himalayan views
Trek through dense pine forests and snow-covered trails
Camp under starry skies at Juda ka Talab and base camp
Witness breathtaking sunrise over Swargarohini, Bandarpoonch & Kala Nag
Experience local village life in Sankri
Cross high-altitude suspension bridges on the trail
Visit mythological Juda ka Talab connected to Lord Shiva
Perfect winter trek for beginners and seasoned hikers
Professional trek leader and support staff throughout
All meals, camping equipment, and permits included
inclusions: Pick from Dehradun
Accommodation in Guest house/Home stay/Camping
Meals while on trek (Vegetarian)
Trekking equipment: comfortable sleeping bag, thick mattress, separate kitchen & dining tent, crampons, utensils

itinerary.title: Dehradun to Sankri – Gateway to the Trek
itinerary.description: Your Kedarkantha tour package will begin as you arrive in the charming Dehradun. From there, our representative will take you to the Sankri village. It will be a drive of eight to ten hours. Enjoy this long drive by inhaling the fresh and fragrant air and admiring the outside view of the mountains and lush green forest. You will even pass through the most beautiful Tons River. With the scenic views, you will reach Sankri in the evening. Check into your hotel, and relax for a while. Take some time to experience the local village life here. Afterward, come back to your accommodation, have your delicious dinner, and then go for a peaceful sleep.

itinerary.title: Sankri to Juda ka Talab – First Day of Trek
itinerary.description: Have breakfast and check out from the guest house. Start your trek from Sankri Village to Juda Ka Talab. Along the way, cross several high-altitude suspension bridges and small villages. Reach Juda Ka Talab, a lake that holds a mythological significance to Lord Shiva. Check into the camps near the lake for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Juda ka Talab to Kedarkantha Base Camp
itinerary.description: On the third day, after enjoying the delicious breakfast at the campsite, get ready to go on an adventurous trek to the Kedarkantha Base Camp. Start your trek with full enthusiasm as you will walk the snow-covered paths and have views of the Great Himalayan peaks like Bandarpoonch, Swargarohini, Kala Nag, and Ranglana. Once you reach the Kedarkantha base camp, situated at an altitude of around 3,400 metres, rest for a while, and then have a mouthwatering dinner. Afterward, go to sleep to prepare yourself for the next day's summit trek.

itinerary.title: Kedarkantha Summit Day – 12,500 ft Peak
highlights: Sunrise over Yamunotri, Gangotri & Kinner Kailash
Trek back to Juda ka Talab
itinerary.description: On the fourth day, get ready for the most awaited day of the Kedarkantha trek itinerary. Wake up early, as you will start your trek around 2 am, under the clear night stars and a chilly wind of night. The trek will be of three to four hours, and as you get closer to the summit, you will see how beautiful the sun's rays fall on the Yamunotri, Gangotri, and Kinner Kailash Himalayan ranges. Don't miss capturing this moment. Continue your trek and as you reach the major highlight of the trek, Kedarkantha Peak, situated at an elevation of 12,500 ft, get a 360-degree view of the surrounding Himalayan peaks, spend some quality time here, and click some pictures. Later, descend back to the base camp and then trek down to the Juda ka Talab. It will take around three to four hours. Once you reach the Juda ka Talab, rest well to erase the trek exhaustion, then rejuvenate yourself with a nutritious dinner, which will be followed by an overnight stay in the tent.

itinerary.title: Juda ka Talab to Sankri to Dehradun – Return Journey
itinerary.description: On the fifth day, rise and shine early, have your delicious breakfast, check out from the campsite, and start a small trek of two to three hours to go back to the Sankri village. Once you reach Sankri village, our driver will take you to Dehradun. Gather all the beautiful memories of the Kedarkantha tour package and get ready to cover the journey back to your home.

keyInfo.title: Trek Overview
points: Kedarkantha Peak altitude: 12,500 ft (3,810 m)
Trek distance: Approximately 20 km one way
Trek duration: 4 days of trekking
Difficulty level: Moderate (beginner friendly)
Best season: December to April (winter snow trek)
Temperature range: Day (5°C to 10°C), Night (-5°C to -10°C)

keyInfo.title: Best Time to Trek
points: December to April – Best for snow trek experience
December-January – Heavy snow, pristine white landscapes
February-March – Stable snow conditions, clear skies
April – Snow starts melting, pleasant weather
May-June – Summer trek, no snow, lush greenery
Avoid monsoon (July-September) due to landslides and leeches

keyInfo.title: Physical Fitness
points: Moderate fitness level required
Regular cardio and strength training recommended before trek
Practice walking on inclines with backpack
Good for beginners with basic fitness
Mental endurance important for early morning summit
Consult doctor if you have any health conditions

keyInfo.title: Weather & Climate
points: Days: Pleasant (5°C to 10°C) with clear skies
Nights: Cold (-5°C to -10°C) at campsites
Summit: Extremely cold with wind chill
Snow conditions vary with season
Weather can change rapidly in mountains
Follow guide's instructions for safety

Trekking pants (2 pairs)
Waterproof trekking shoes with good grip

Sunglasses with UV protection
Sunscreen (SPF 50+) and lip balm

Personal medications and first aid kit
Snacks, energy bars, dry fruits
